This patch enable extensions:
-[H106] Do not put vim configuration in source files.
-[H203] Use assertIs(Not)None to check for None.
-[H204] Use assert(Not)Equal to check for equality.
-[H205] Use assert(Greater|Less)(Equal) for comparison.
-[H904] Delay string interpolations at logging calls.

commit_message:
Enable more hacking-extensions

This patch enable extensions:
-[H106] Do not put vim configuration in source files.
-[H204] Use assert(Not)Equal to check for equality.
-[H205] Use assert(Greater|Less)(Equal) for comparison.

Change-Id: I7fa2c8753b2b471f44afe8ee83a4a612ed1b76a9

commit_message:
Native Zuul v3 jobs

Use the jobs defined by sahara-tests, and force the installation of
the saharaclient code by tuning LIBS_FROM_GIT.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/512058
Change-Id: I33641a575b0529d6ff53ca9cf2b14e7d67d53084

commit_message:
bagpipe-bgp: EVPN OVS driver fixes

This fixes issues not catched by earlier tests:
- TunnelManager is shared so "used by" handles need
  to include instance_id's
- need OF1.3 for mod_vlan_vid
- delete_port takes a port id, not a name
- gateway port methods can be empty

Change-Id: I7377aa0f7e6422ce8806153518832525fb0e70ff
Related-bug: 1719337

Thanks.

Do not this need to be fixed in the python libvirt wrapper?
It is possible other libvirt operations (migration?) could fail with
unicode as well.'}, {'account_id': 20722, 'date': '2018-02-02 03:39:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12:

(1 comment)

> Thanks.
 > 
 > Do not this need to be fixed in the python libvirt wrapper?
 > It is possible other libvirt operations (migration?) could fail
 > with
 > unicode as well.

Hi, Andrey, thanks for review. As the tracestack on the bug description:

File "/usr/lib64/python2.7/site-packages/libvirt.py", line 3817, in defineXML
    ret = libvirtmod.virDomainDefineXML(self._o, xml)

and I find this method maybe from libvirtmod.so, I'm not familiar with it, so,
I'm not sure we should fix it in the python libvirt wrapper.

IMO _create_domain is the common function to create domain xml in nova, 
So, other libvirt operations will works well when we fix this.'}, {'account_id': 20722, 'date': '2018-02-02 04:04:34.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 13.'}, {'account_id': 23498, 'date': '2018-02-02 04:57:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 13:

commit_message:
Encode libvirt domain XML in UTF-8

Creating a VM with a non-ASCII name results in an error. Resolve
this by encoding the libvirt domain XML in utf-8.

Co-Authored-By: Yikun Jiang <yikunkero@gmail.com>

Closes-Bug: #1730756
Change-Id: I7afce618deca3baaa96605a6b48c1c2ef4a5f2a5

commit_message:
Tabs in launch server wizard not depending on OPENSTACK_NOVA_EXTENSIONS_BLACKLIST

OPENSTACK_NOVA_EXTENSIONS_BLACKLIST is used to disable specific extension.
In the launch instance wizard, by example the Server Group tab should be hidden
when the extension "ServerGroups" is blacklisted but it isn't.

It could be interesting to make these tabs dependent of the supported extensions.

Change-Id: I15ea0f1010e3889c217c63e98f1752a4c1ad9ceb
Closes-Bug: #1745367

commit_message:
Tabs in launch server wizard not depending on OPENSTACK_NOVA_EXTENSIONS_BLACKLIST

OPENSTACK_NOVA_EXTENSIONS_BLACKLIST is used to disable specific extension.
In the launch instance wizard, by example the Server Group tab should be hidden
when the extension "ServerGroups" is blacklisted but it isn't.

It could be interesting to make these tabs dependent of the supported extensions.

Change-Id: Ie13229af89598ef322c5ac7a0664fcfdd4720297
Closes-Bug: #1745367

commit_message:
Add native Zuul v3 jobs

The new jobs matches the behavior of the existing jobs.
Most of new jobs are newly defined, and the shared pylint job
is used.

This changes introduces the native versions of:
- tempest tests (API, CLI and clients, unifying two legacy
  jobs);
- scenario tests: basic, py3, modwsgi and multinode.

Multinode is not working for now due to incomplete support in native
Zuul v3 jobs.

tls-proxy is disabled for now, as it produces failures in the job;
previously it was not enabled, so this regression may be old.

Change-Id: Icf22643f17ea0500ceef38f493bd98d49bd9a3bd

commit_message:
trivial: Fix microversion number in test comment

search hypervisor and List servers of hypervisor APIs
have been deprecated in version 2.53:
 I828350c179df8bcfa4739910abeafaba2f96982b

due to multiple rebase during that patch merge,
few unit tests have old microvesion(2.48) in test comment.

Change-Id: I788adee1087d3db4cc0403497e6f10dbfdcaa68c

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-01 14:42:37.000000000', 'message': 'test_compute_mgr: fix couple of unit tests

_test_shutdown_instance_exception() is a helper function used to
exercise several exceptional paths in _shutdown_instance(). However, if
the "attached_id" property of the mocked BDM is not explicitly set to
None, we won't take the exceptional paths in the function under test.
This patch fixes this by setting attachment_id=None.

Change-Id: I95854d5c0d6663ee2d858755a95694bda84e5973
'}]
commit_message:
test_compute_mgr: fix couple of unit tests

_test_shutdown_instance_exception() is a helper function used to
exercise several exceptional paths in _shutdown_instance(). However, if
the "attached_id" property of the mocked BDM is not explicitly set to
None, we won't take the exceptional paths in the function under test.
This patch fixes this by setting attachment_id=None.

Change-Id: I95854d5c0d6663ee2d858755a95694bda84e5973

after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the
requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

subject: Fix instance dir check when spawning
messages: [{'account_id': 8543, 'date': '2018-02-08 15:21:36.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 8543, 'date': '2018-02-09 09:07:29.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 8213, 'date': '2018-02-09 12:44:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-08 15:21:36.000000000', 'message': "Fix instance dir check when spawning

When spawning instances, we're checking if the instance dir
already exists, in which case we're logging a message, stating
that existing instance files will be reused.

Well, at least that's what we thought we were doing. Actually,
we're always logging this message as the check is wrong.

This change fixes this issue.

Change-Id: I6cf52ae23d90e687103e8bea0b6c4f9eaba6d36c
Closes-Bug: #1747961
"}, {'created': '2018-02-09 09:07:29.000000000', 'message': "Fix instance dir check when spawning

When spawning instances, we're checking if the instance dir
already exists, in which case we're logging a message, stating
that existing instance files will be reused.

Well, at least that's what we thought we were doing. Actually,
we're always logging this message as the check is wrong.

This change fixes this issue.

Change-Id: I6cf52ae23d90e687103e8bea0b6c4f9eaba6d36c
Closes-Bug: #1747961

commit_message:
Fix instance dir check when spawning

When spawning instances, we're checking if the instance dir
already exists, in which case we're logging a message, stating
that existing instance files will be reused.

Well, at least that's what we thought we were doing. Actually,
we're always logging this message as the check is wrong.

This change fixes this issue.

Change-Id: I6cf52ae23d90e687103e8bea0b6c4f9eaba6d36c
Closes-Bug: #1747961

subject: Fix breaking unit tests due to iso8601 changes
messages: [{'account_id': 14760, 'date': '2018-02-07 05:10:27.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2018-02-07 18:01:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2018-02-09 11:32:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-07 05:10:27.000000000', 'message': "Fix breaking unit tests due to iso8601 changes

The move from iso8601===0.1.11 to iso8601===0.1.12 broke unit
tests in oslo.utils.

iso8601 used to do:
    from datetime import datetime

But now they call datetime.datetime():
    import datetime
    datetime.datetime()

Unfortunately the unit tests that mocked datetime.datetime() are now
mocking the one in iso8601. This causes a failure in the unit tests.

Fix this by using the 'wraps' argument to mock. So that the calls will
get passed through to datetime.datetime. Also changed to using the
decorator style of mock.

In addition Python 3 unit tests were broken due to changing how the
UTC time zone is represented from 'UTC' to 'UTC+00:00'.

Closes-Bug: #1747575
Closes-Bug: #1744160
Change-Id: Ia80ffb5e571cc5366bef2bc1a32c457a3c16843d
(cherry picked from commit 010fe3b1023871740b57dbc450f80e6c0c0f6e43)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix breaking unit tests due to iso8601 changes

The move from iso8601===0.1.11 to iso8601===0.1.12 broke unit
tests in oslo.utils.

iso8601 used to do:
    from datetime import datetime

But now they call datetime.datetime():
    import datetime
    datetime.datetime()

Unfortunately the unit tests that mocked datetime.datetime() are now
mocking the one in iso8601. This causes a failure in the unit tests.

Fix this by using the 'wraps' argument to mock. So that the calls will
get passed through to datetime.datetime. Also changed to using the
decorator style of mock.

In addition Python 3 unit tests were broken due to changing how the
UTC time zone is represented from 'UTC' to 'UTC+00:00'.

Closes-Bug: #1747575
Closes-Bug: #1744160
Change-Id: Ia80ffb5e571cc5366bef2bc1a32c457a3c16843d
(cherry picked from commit 010fe3b1023871740b57dbc450f80e6c0c0f6e43)

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

commit_message:
Remove redundant call to add_instance_fault_from_exc in rebuild_instance

nova.scheduler.utils.set_vm_state_and_notify already calls
add_instance_fault_from_exc so we can remove the redundant call.

The assertion in the test_rebuild_with_image_novalidhost functional
test shows that the fault is still set on the instance.

Change-Id: I8c0074ac7953fe7f777ab23c56ccfa1c26820cc9

commit_message:
tasks: Ensure Open vSwitch is started for all providers that need it

Previously, openvswitch was only started when we were using the ODL
provider but we should start it for all providers that need it. As such
we move the conditional which checks whether Open vSwitch is needed into
a new variable and we use that to start/enable the service and also to
install the package when needed.

Change-Id: I4ec4fc2c2124a941f24478cbdf39ed34c0dce56f

Thanks, this will simplify my local configuration using a local mirror :)

It would be really great if we could also document using a local squid cache for e.g images & the pip install things - IME the quickstart working dir cache isn't ideal as often quickstart will fail unless you use --clean, so you end up downloading ~2G of data every run which could be cached locally."}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-08 10:58:26.000000000', 'message': 'Add support of local CentOS mirrors for quickstart

When running quickstart locally it worth to use local CentOS
mirror for deploying faster.
For using this option you need to export NODEPOOL_CENTOS_MIRROR
variable on your host when you execute quickstart.sh:
Example:
export NODEPOOL_CENTOS_MIRROR=http://mirror.besthosting.ua/
./quickstart.sh ....

Change-Id: I1e472a09682759354122f147b53ba5a84dde12d2
'}]
commit_message:
Add support of local CentOS mirrors for quickstart

When running quickstart locally it worth to use local CentOS
mirror for deploying faster.
For using this option you need to export NODEPOOL_CENTOS_MIRROR
variable on your host when you execute quickstart.sh:
Example:
export NODEPOOL_CENTOS_MIRROR=http://mirror.besthosting.ua/
./quickstart.sh ....

Change-Id: I1e472a09682759354122f147b53ba5a84dde12d2

commit_message:
Increase the Mistral cron_trigger interval

Reducing the frequency of the Mistral cron trigger subsystem greatly reduces
the load that is has on the system. Previously it would query the
database every second, now it will only do this every 10 minutes.

Closes-Bug: #1747386
Depends-On: I6445ff1b6691a098f15e8402ae9d971e751f5552
Depends-On: I9060253bc416be28af4ef81f3edf694059d92066
Change-Id: I18ae5bc0b2192a393959186ba756d1e6a6c62d83

commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/queens

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the
requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

Change-Id: I399e6c9a90637ee950a94bb53d7fb38817e58a68

commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/queens

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the
requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

Change-Id: If85c5bfb8e3d65f22291a479576d48849761f8f4

subject: Revert "drop notifications_designate"
messages: [{'account_id': 24824, 'date': '2018-02-05 12:00:56.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 24824, 'date': '2018-02-08 14:19:57.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 12549, 'date': '2018-02-09 11:43:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2\n\nLGTM, tested with mojo spec specs/full_stack/next_deploy_designate/newton followed by manual aodh testing'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-05 12:00:56.000000000', 'message': 'use both notifications and notifications_designate

Change I17d0036f6dcbfd0e87849091e453d2a8b2bc498f, commit hash
45792d3c865149f2c94cef42b19c1385d7f7b0ee dropped notifications_designate
completely, however, this is a backwards incompatible change.

notifications_designate should still be used to send notifications to
designate while the "notifications" topic should be used for ceilometer
notifications.

In order to make this change uniformly in nova and in neutron, templates
contain "notifications" topic unconditionally with optionally and
additional topic depending on relation availability.

Change-Id: I496f54d9917fe8c8279ebb91cc2fed02b74b181c
Related-Bug: #1710831
Related-Bug: #1738100
'}, {'created': '2018-02-08 14:19:57.000000000', 'message': 'Revert "drop notifications_designate"

This reverts commit 45792d3c865149f2c94cef42b19c1385d7f7b0ee.

During the discussions in reviews relevant to the bugs below the
decision was to use both notifications_designate and notifications
topics.

Related-Bug: #1710831
Related-Bug: #1738100
Change-Id: I496f54d9917fe8c8279ebb91cc2fed02b74b181c
'}]
commit_message:
Revert "drop notifications_designate"

This reverts commit 45792d3c865149f2c94cef42b19c1385d7f7b0ee.

During the discussions in reviews relevant to the bugs below the
decision was to use both notifications_designate and notifications
topics.

Related-Bug: #1710831
Related-Bug: #1738100
Change-Id: I496f54d9917fe8c8279ebb91cc2fed02b74b181c

subject: emit notifications on notifications_designate
messages:
[{'account_id': 24824, 'date': '2018-02-05 11:40:01.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 24824, 'date': '2018-02-05 12:00:13.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 12549, 'date': '2018-02-08 14:00:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

The nova.conf templates include the section-oslo-notifications template fragment which also sets topics (and I believe supersedes the setting topics in the default sections). In section-oslo-notifications there is no hardcoded 'notifications' topic so "ctxt['notification_topics'] = 'notifications_designate'" will remove updates from being broadcast on the notifications topic.'}, {'account_id': 24824, 'date': '2018-02-08 14:07:29.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 24824, 'date': '2018-02-08 14:25:53.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 12549, 'date': '2018-02-09 11:43:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2

commit_message:
emit notifications on notifications_designate

Change I804a34fb044090010ecfd2560594cc1f55e9bd21, commit hash
b89de21d47dc9114d20456452cd867041bcd83c5 dropped notifications_designate
completely to solve a problem described in pad.lv/1738100, however, to
make this change backwards compatible notifications_designate should be
used in addition to "notifications" topic used by default.

This way designate will continue to receive notifications on
notifications_designate from nova, and ceilometer will get notifications
using the "notifications" topic.

Change-Id: I245f5b263994c204a5e521dad542ed83952f54b8
Related-Bug: #1710831
Related-Bug: #1738100

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-05 11:35:43.000000000', 'message': 'reintroduce designate_notifications topic

Change I709a6aca1843918a67d43bc4808a0013168fbc55, commit hash
1879b16ea543b076c9555fdc0258355d39af9ad0 introduced a
backwards-incompatible change in the fact that designate stopped
consuming messages using designate_notifications topic from nova and
neutron.

While designate.conf change in the mentioned commit is needed to make
sure Designate emits its own notifications on the topic that ceilometer
uses ("notifications"), for nova and neutron to designate notifications
a separate topic should be used as before.

A revert of the previous commit is not done as it addresses the previous
issue but introduces a new one.

Change-Id: I6b5fd1b5f9bae1cd4a1683fd476b456e81d6c79e
Related-Bug: #1710831
'}]
commit_message:
reintroduce designate_notifications topic

Change I709a6aca1843918a67d43bc4808a0013168fbc55, commit hash
1879b16ea543b076c9555fdc0258355d39af9ad0 introduced a
backwards-incompatible change in the fact that designate stopped
consuming messages using designate_notifications topic from nova and
neutron.

While designate.conf change in the mentioned commit is needed to make
sure Designate emits its own notifications on the topic that ceilometer
uses ("notifications"), for nova and neutron to designate notifications
a separate topic should be used as before.

A revert of the previous commit is not done as it addresses the previous
issue but introduces a new one.

Change-Id: I6b5fd1b5f9bae1cd4a1683fd476b456e81d6c79e
Related-Bug: #1710831

[{'created': '2018-02-08 14:06:12.000000000', 'message': 'Really make the cron trigger execution interval configurable

Note: This is an update to I9060253bc416be28af4ef81f3edf694059d92066,
      which almost worked but due to a race condition with config loading
      the default value may have been used. This delays the decorator
      execution to allow the config to be fully loaded.

The cron_trigger subsystem in Mistral queries the database every second
to look for triggers that require execution. This can be very wasteful
if your deployment only has cron triggers that run infrequently (every
hour or day etc.). Letting operators configure this value reduces the
load and allows the cron triggers to be useful in more scenarios.

Operators do need to be aware that this configuration would limit the
frequency of execution. For example, if the value is set to 600 then cron
triggers configured to run every minute will only run every 10 minutes.

Related-Bug: #1747386
Change-Id: Ia12dcf7fa6b1784be226d223eb89b114c8e4b4f5

commit_message:
Really make the cron trigger execution interval configurable

Note: This is an update to I9060253bc416be28af4ef81f3edf694059d92066,
      which almost worked but due to a race condition with config loading
      the default value may have been used. This delays the decorator
      execution to allow the config to be fully loaded.

The cron_trigger subsystem in Mistral queries the database every second
to look for triggers that require execution. This can be very wasteful
if your deployment only has cron triggers that run infrequently (every
hour or day etc.). Letting operators configure this value reduces the
load and allows the cron triggers to be useful in more scenarios.

Operators do need to be aware that this configuration would limit the
frequency of execution. For example, if the value is set to 600 then cron
triggers configured to run every minute will only run every 10 minutes.

Related-Bug: #1747386
Change-Id: Ia12dcf7fa6b1784be226d223eb89b114c8e4b4f5

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the
requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

Change-Id: I4df9e52151483c4539ef701d57b234fbf148728e
"}]
commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/queens

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the
requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

Change-Id: I4df9e52151483c4539ef701d57b234fbf148728e

commit_message:
Revert "Switch the LXD compute driver test to non-voting"

This reverts commit 1aaa6b4449775a6de7bb8f4a0dab3dc69d7b2f57.

Now that we have an upstream library we can use to get the
LXD driver working again, we can make the test voting.

Note that due to the way we execute the tests, the dependent
patch noted below will have to merge before this patch will
pass tests.

Change-Id: I58c9d1bfe49d97a3882a6dd43c9a41a413fe0fab
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/541259

The unit tests went fine, so Ie4ad57f6357c59f2a978467099642b08e730133e does solve our gate issue.

However, with Ie4ad57f6357c59f2a978467099642b08e730133e, we'll have the new-style for OVO, but all the base framework operation are still old-style facade (e.g. [1] [2]).

So, the next question I have is the following: if mixing new-style and old-style is a bad idea, then I guess the whole DB operations in networking-bagpipe needs to switch to the new-style.  

No test fails, but I don't know exactly to what kind if risk we're exposed if we keep the mix.
I'll work on a change to move all the DB operations to the new-facade.

commit_message:
Make stackenv file visible

We collect this file as part of the logs of gate jobs, so one can assume
that it is important enough that it should be visible in the first
place.

Change-Id: I3208f884a132a1e7d06172f7e490b375c69c80e3

commit_message:
devstack: prepare sudoers and rootwrap setup

This change steals devstack/lib/neutron:_neutron_setup_rootwrap
to prepare a proper environment to let bagpipe-bgp use
oslo-rootwrap.

Change-Id: Ic783250c7944f722791927bcc03cac6c67e65be2

commit_message:
Prep-CI for routed-networks changes

Once we have segments service plug-in enabled and
updated ironic flat interface code we need to set
the physical-network property of the baremetal
ports.

For upgrades this is not required, since the subnet
on the ctlplane network is not associated with a
segment on an undercloud that was upgraded.

Change-Id: I93ffc4fffa18e23e1285cc858cc87356723defc2
Implements: blueprint tripleo-routed-networks-deployment

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-08 23:08:06.000000000', 'message': 'Remove validate_boot_option_for_trusted_boot metric

This removes the timing metric "validate_boot_option_for_trusted_boot"
because the validate_boot_parameters_for_trusted_boot() function is
an internal function that is called by PXEBoot.validate() -- which
is handled by the "PXEBoot.validate" metric. We shouldn't be emitting
metrics for such short-lived, internal functions.

Change-Id: Iaaa573fc4f128d6c3e20faf9c94259b352874eb8
'}]
commit_message:
Remove validate_boot_option_for_trusted_boot metric

This removes the timing metric "validate_boot_option_for_trusted_boot"
because the validate_boot_parameters_for_trusted_boot() function is
an internal function that is called by PXEBoot.validate() -- which
is handled by the "PXEBoot.validate" metric. We shouldn't be emitting
metrics for such short-lived, internal functions.

Change-Id: Iaaa573fc4f128d6c3e20faf9c94259b352874eb8

commit_message:
Remove editor mode setting from goals template

Not everyone uses the same text editors, and it's annoying to have
one person's preferred editor configuration encoded into files meant
for others to edit. Remove the emacs mode variable comment from the
top of the goals template, since not only was it setting someone's
editor preference on a file but doing so on a file meant as an
example for others to copy. If people want to set particular editor
modes automatically, they can do so based on the filename pattern
(we're pretty consistent about setting clear suffixes).

Change-Id: I60932b0a2d86f23de6d80637b04f3c0f76830b70

commit_message:
Rename goals/template.txt to .rst

We expect goal authors to edit goals/template.txt as
reStructuredText and save as a new file with a .rst suffix, so we
should give the template that suffix as well for clarity. Add it to
the exclusion list so that Sphinx won't mind.

Change-Id: Ied69b10a64a715b89cc3ee72f544c8525a25a4d7

Hmm, looks like it might not be so easy? I don't know much about how the project is set up, especially with regards to devstack, so I will leave this up to the team.

Another option is to change the publishing job to release-openstack-server instead of publish-to-pypi for this cycle. That will give you more time to work out the naming problems.

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-08 18:53:13.000000000', 'message': 'Update package name to match pypi name

There is a magnum package registered on pypi, but it is a
different one from this project. This one actually is set
up as openstack-magnum.

There is a 2.0.0 version out there, but that must have been
done manually. With the current name set in setup.cfg,
release jobs that attempt to publish magnum to pypi fail
due to not having permission with the other magnum project.

This changes the package name in setup.cfg to match the
openstack-magnum name so publishing will go to the correct
project.

Change-Id: I210429b34353f2a05e2d1d19afdff18f134aa780
'}]
commit_message:
Update package name to match pypi name

There is a magnum package registered on pypi, but it is a
different one from this project. This one actually is set
up as openstack-magnum.

There is a 2.0.0 version out there, but that must have been
done manually. With the current name set in setup.cfg,
release jobs that attempt to publish magnum to pypi fail
due to not having permission with the other magnum project.

This changes the package name in setup.cfg to match the
openstack-magnum name so publishing will go to the correct
project.

Change-Id: I210429b34353f2a05e2d1d19afdff18f134aa780

commit_message:
Correct task tag

The 'Check if log dir exists' task is tagged as 'rsyslog_client-install'
but registers a variable that is only used by an 'rsyslog_client-config'
tagged task.

Change-Id: I97c3b37a4cc26f0f074f37f992d4764ab75abfdc
(cherry picked from commit 0ee4ebced14e6f8058e4651d80ebac27b9c989fd)

For the curious - a recent chaned allowed us to limit how frequently
mistral looks for cron triggers that need executed. There was an issue
with it, that should be resolved now (see the depends on). This change
is just being used to verify that in CI. Making this workflow run every
minute, we would expect to see a number of exections (but with the limit
in place we should only see one every 10 mins). CI duration should be
long enough for us to see one or two if it works (or many if there is
still an issue).

This patch will be abandoned afterwards.

commit_message:
DNM. Testing Mistral Cron Trigger

For the curious - a recent chaned allowed us to limit how frequently
mistral looks for cron triggers that need executed. There was an issue
with it, that should be resolved now (see the depends on). This change
is just being used to verify that in CI. Making this workflow run every
minute, we would expect to see a number of exections (but with the limit
in place we should only see one every 10 mins). CI duration should be
long enough for us to see one or two if it works (or many if there is
still an issue).

This patch will be abandoned afterwards.

Change-Id: I96295d0a01bef404cdf2ca5110e005cca38e7abe
Depends-On: Ia12dcf7fa6b1784be226d223eb89b114c8e4b4f5

commit_message:
Enable OVN deployment

Adding the deployment of OVN, this currently depends on multinode. I am
not against the idea of moving this out of multinode if we feel it
should be its on var.

Change-Id: I1ecb53d0d84775a66e13e4b5de29c7a1b51eaf0e

[{'created': '2018-01-15 14:13:24.000000000', 'message': "Replace virtualenv-tools by a script

virtualenv-tools has a bug which gets triggered in gates: it can't
change the shebang of a virtualenv python bin/ files if they
were generated with a virtualenv script whose shebang ends with
python2 instead of python.

Because we can't modify virtualenv-tools, we use shell scripts
instead.

commit_message:
Replace virtualenv-tools by a script

virtualenv-tools has a bug which gets triggered in gates: it can't
change the shebang of a virtualenv python bin/ files if they
were generated with a virtualenv script whose shebang ends with
python2 instead of python.

Because we can't modify virtualenv-tools, we use shell scripts
instead.

Change-Id: I7c4f7acf052989bd0947b0c54e2f539639cf834c
Partial-Bug: #1741634

commit_message:
If debug is enabled, provide verbose output for host discovery

In order to aid debugging, we add the '--verbose' CLI option to
the discovery command. This gives us a little more information
to work with when looking through the logs.

Change-Id: I194a1b20ceba4def8cac9591ef9bf0abf0b7f77f
(cherry picked from commit ec4c2624783328dc755a5090e4843997e630dc3e)

commit_message:
Fixes using SSL OVSDB connection

When creating SSL OVSDB connection it is required to set the private
key, certificate, and the CA certificate in order to communicate with
OVSDB.  This patch configures these when an SSL connection URI is used.
The settings must be provided as part of neutron.conf under [ovs]
section.

Closes-Bug: 1745038

Change-Id: I19fd9dd0c72260835eb91e557a6029ec9d652179
Signed-off-by: Tim Rozet <trozet@redhat.com>

This patch uninstalls the MySQL server from the system when

client.

commit_message:
Revert "RedHat: Ensure that conflicting MariaDB packages are removed"

This patch uninstalls the MySQL server from the system when
it shouldn't be messing about with it as the role manages the
client.

This reverts commit 72cc31a4d6107a69f3d9d5f2bd287112385df1c2.

Change-Id: Ief5cf57e23dfbf9a05aa9051d0ec46d85ac19bbf

commit_message:
Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

Change-Id: I44f1889047b6ed65fd283b4ee4c4193567d42e03

commit_message:
Pass project_id in dimensions rather than query parameter

This changes resource_id to a resource dimension rather than a function
parameter in monasca collector.

Change-Id: I57e0cecf71743d4c7d66b5210fe831c676d195e1

commit_message:
Remove pip_install dependency

With addition of pip_install on every node, we don't
need to have pip_install as a meta dependency.

Depends-On: If3412bb888ebb854874bbc43eb76bfcb3e4a7868
Depends-On: I79ff70c438b44753be2a93f004ebbc46de0a963d
Change-Id: Ida4ab55cde5b220d62a5b2ae4a503bffd1f82497

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-09 08:09:46.000000000', 'message': 'Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

Change-Id: I45e8357ad44fb0522dbdf0bbd6ac9f98698e0438
'}]
commit_message:
Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

Change-Id: I45e8357ad44fb0522dbdf0bbd6ac9f98698e0438

commit_message:
Consider size of output_on_error

While printing the output of a execution
size of output_on_error is not considered
with the field_size_limit_kb

This patch udpates the function to include
the logical calculation of total size limit

Closes-Bug: #1690316
Change-Id: Icab63d147f580b8d72d8c02b3d9261fd64d3438a

Example:
$ openstack cluster profile type ops os.heat.stack-1.0
operations:
  abandon:
    description: Abandon a heat stack node.
    required: false
    type: Map
    updatable: false

Also, you can refer to API: https://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/clustering/?expanded=list-profile-type-operations-detail#list-profile-type-operations

messages:
[{'account_id': 27778, 'date': '2018-02-06 17:03:43.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2018-02-06 17:03:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
    Workflow: http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
    Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 27778, 'date': '2018-02-07 09:02:15.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 8731, 'date': '2018-02-08 07:05:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2

commit_message:
Tempest: Enable pagination, sorting and project-id API extensions

This patch is enabling the pagination, sorting and project-id API
extensions. Tests that were skipped due to this extensions not being
enabled should now run in gate.

This patch should also fix the following tests that are currently
failing in gate:

neutron_tempest_plugin.api.test_extensions.ExtensionsTest.test_list_extensions_pagination
neutron_tempest_plugin.api.test_extensions.ExtensionsTest.test_list_extensions_project_id
neutron_tempest_plugin.api.test_extensions.ExtensionsTest.test_list_extensions_sorting

Change-Id: I5b2bef6dbb1077834c4a4966af6a0608ad087fc2

commit_message:
Correct task tag

The 'Check if log dir exists' task is tagged as 'rsyslog_client-install'
but registers a variable that is only used by an 'rsyslog_client-config'
tagged task.

Change-Id: I97c3b37a4cc26f0f074f37f992d4764ab75abfdc
(cherry picked from commit 0ee4ebced14e6f8058e4651d80ebac27b9c989fd)

subject: bump client version to meet tacker server needs
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 308, 'name': 'Thierry Carrez', 'email': 'thierry@openstack.org', 'username': 'ttx'}, {'_account_id': 2472, 'name': 'Doug Hellmann', 'email': 'dhellmann@redhat.com', 'username': 'doug-hellmann'}, {'_account_id': 2874, 'name': 'yong sheng gong', 'email': 'gong.yongsheng@99cloud.net', 'username': 'gongysh'}, {'_account_id': 11904, 'name': 'Sean McGinnis', 'email': 'sean.mcginnis@gmail.com', 'username': 'SeanM'}, {'_account_id': 14288, 'name': 'Matthew Thode', 'display_name': 'prometheanfire', 'email': 'mthode@mthode.org', 'username': 'prometheanfire'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 2874, 'date': '2018-02-07 09:40:01.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2018-02-07 10:45:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

This request is past the client library release deadline (Jan 26). It's a bit late for an exception, but then python-tackerclient is only used in mistral, rpm-packaging, tacker and tacker-horizon.

This should probably be 1.12.0 given the feature addition.
Also do you expect to need a global-requirements bump ? Will the tacker final release work with current requirements (>=0.8.0) ?"}, {'account_id': 2874, 'date': '2018-02-07 14:06:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

tacker will need the newer version to work. mistral, tacker-horizon do not hurt from it.'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-02-07 14:09:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

You will need to start a thread on the mailing list with a subject like "[requirements][release] FFE for constraints update for python-tackerclient bug-fix release" to get the release team to sign off.'}, {'account_id': 2874, 'date': '2018-02-07 14:11:34.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 2874, 'date': '2018-02-07 14:20:55.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-02-07 17:38:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1

We have approval for the upper-constraints change from Matthew on the mailing list. The impact should be minimal:

  $ whatuses python-tackerclient
  mistral               requirements.txt           python-tackerclient>=0.8.0 # Apache-2.0
  requirements          global-requirements.txt    python-tackerclient>=0.8.0  # Apache-2.0
  requirements          upper-constraints.txt      python-tackerclient===0.11.0
  rpm-packaging         global-requirements.txt    python-tackerclient>=0.8.0  # Apache-2.0
  rpm-packaging         requirements.txt           python-tackerclient>=0.8.0  # Apache-2.0
  tacker                test-requirements.txt      python-tackerclient>=0.8.0 # Apache-2.0
  tacker-horizon        requirements.txt           python-tackerclient>=0.8.0 # Apache-2.0

There are still some unanswered questions on the mailing list, though, so I will hold off approving until those are answered.'}, {'account_id': 2874, 'date': '2018-02-08 03:42:35.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

hellmann, 
these are questions on email list:

It should have time to get in for the freeze, the question I have is
'What in openstack is broken if we update upper-contraints after the
freeze instead of before?'

A follow up question is 'does this need a global-requirements.txt bump?'

are these question for me?"}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-02-08 03:52:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Yes, please respond to those questions on the mailing list.'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-02-08 14:01:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

> hellmann,
 > these are questions on email list:
 > 
 > It should have time to get in for the freeze, the question I have
 > is
 > 'What in openstack is broken if we update upper-contraints after
 > the
 > freeze instead of before?'
 > 
 > A follow up question is 'does this need a global-requirements.txt
 > bump?'
 > 
 > are these question for me?

Yes. We need to understand what functionality will fail to work without this release, and whether we can safely wait until after the requirements freeze has been lifted (that should happen in the next few weeks but I can't give you an exact date without talking to the requirements team and they are the ones asking the questions on the mailing list so we should discuss this further there)."}, {'account_id': 2874, 'date': '2018-02-08 16:10:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

I think we prefer to exclude the feature from queens cycle since the tacker server is required to release when we have no time to merge this feature's server side. thanks anyway."}, {'account_id': 2874, 'date': '2018-02-08 16:12:18.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}, {'account_id': 2874, 'date': '2018-02-09 08:17:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Doug Hellmann, when will we be able to do it?'}]

commit_message:
bump client version to meet tacker server needs

This version bump adds reno notes and cluster feature client
for queens release.

the global-requriement can stay on the first version of queens tacker
client.

Mistral and tacker-horizon does not hurt from this upgrade
since they are not using the new features.

Tacker server will include a new feature. If user wants
to use it, he/she will need this newer version of tacker client.

Change-Id: I5bc3d12ba995ea13c45a9d0c0e3a86c2370e176c

commit_message:
Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

Change-Id: Ia42ee88851861b79124425b103b694ae2aeed0de

commit_message:
Make grenade-devstack-barbican job nonvoting

While this issue is being resolved, have the job become nonvoting
for now in order to not hold up any changes that may need to get
merged.

Change-Id: Ia4f3ed72fc4a8a2699be71e5ddd7f9eb55c97b67

commit_message:
Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

Change-Id: I359619cb7423ef9e070461bf576cc15671b580b1

[{'created': '2018-02-09 07:04:04.000000000', 'message': "Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/queens

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the
requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

Change-Id: Ib236fc8958c081c51adccc2f671ab90897c28d59
"}]
commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/queens

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the
requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

Change-Id: Ib236fc8958c081c51adccc2f671ab90897c28d59

'}, {'created': '2018-02-08 20:08:37.000000000', 'message': "Allow objects to opt in new engine facade

New facade is enabled by setting new_facade = True for the object of
interest. With new_facade on, all OVO actions will use the new reader /
writer decorator to activate sessions.

There are two facade decorators added to OVO: _facade and
_reader_facade. (To consider: rename that into something more clear /
make public.)

All neutron.objects.db.api helpers now receive OVO classes / objects
instead of model classes, since they need to know which type of engine
facade to use for which object. (To consider: is it an issue for
backwards compatibility?)

This patch also adds several new OVO objects to be able to continue
using neutron.objects.db.api helpers to persist models that previously
didn't have corresponding OVO classes.

Finally, the patch adds registration for missing options in
neutron/tests/unit/extensions/test_qos_fip.py to be able to debug
failures in those unit tests. Strictly speaking, this change doesn't
belong to the patch, so: To consider dropping option registration.

There are several non-obvious changes included, specifically:

- in neutron.objects.base, decorator() that refreshes / expunges models
from the active session now opens a subtransaction for the whole span of
call / refresh / expunge, so that we can safely refresh model regardless
of whether caller opened another parent subtransaction (it was not the
case for create_subnetpool in base db plugin code).

- in neutron.db.l3_fip_qos, removed code that updates obj.db_model
relationship directly after corresponding insertions for child policy
binding model. This code is not needed because the only caller to the
_process_extra_fip_qos_update method refetches latest state of floating
ip OVO object anyway, and this code triggers several unit test failures.

Change-Id: I15ec238c18a464f977f7d1079605b82965052311
Related-Bug: #1746996
"}, {'created': '2018-02-08 22:16:12.000000000', 'message': "Allow objects to opt in new engine facade

New facade is enabled by setting new_facade = True for the object of
interest. With new_facade on, all OVO actions will use the new reader /
writer decorator to activate sessions.

There are two new facade decorators added to OVO: db_context_reader and
db_context_write that should be used instead of explicit
autonested_transaction / reader.using / writer.using in OVO context.

All neutron.objects.db.api helpers now receive OVO classes / objects
instead of model classes, since they need to know which type of engine
facade to use for which object. While it means we change signatures for
those helper functions, they are not used anywhere outside neutron tree
except vmware-nsx unit tests, and the latter pass anyway because the
tests completely mock out them disregarding their signatures.

This patch also adds several new OVO objects to be able to continue
using neutron.objects.db.api helpers to persist models that previously
didn't have corresponding OVO classes.

Finally, the patch adds registration for missing options in
neutron/tests/unit/extensions/test_qos_fip.py to be able to debug
failures in those unit tests. Strictly speaking, this change doesn't
belong to the patch, but I include it nevertheless to speed up merge in
time close to release.

There are several non-obvious changes included, specifically:

- in neutron.objects.base, decorator() that refreshes / expunges models
from the active session now opens a subtransaction for the whole span of
call / refresh / expunge, so that we can safely refresh model regardless
of whether caller opened another parent subtransaction (it was not the
case for create_subnetpool in base db plugin code).

- in neutron.db.l3_fip_qos, removed code that updates obj.db_model
relationship directly after corresponding insertions for child policy
binding model. This code is not needed because the only caller to the
_process_extra_fip_qos_update method refetches latest state of floating
ip OVO object anyway, and this code triggers several unit test failures.

- unit tests checking that a single commit happens for get_object and
get_objects are no longer valid for new facade objects that use reader
decorator that doesn't commit but close. This change is as intended, so
unit tests were tweaked to check close for new facade objects.

Change-Id: I15ec238c18a464f977f7d1079605b82965052311
Related-Bug: #1746996
"}, {'created': '2018-02-08 23:23:36.000000000', 'message': "Allow objects to opt in new engine facade

"}, {'created': '2018-02-09 02:29:02.000000000', 'message': "Allow objects to opt in new engine facade

interest. With new_facade on, all OVO actions will use the new reader /
writer decorator to activate sessions.

There are two new facade decorators added to OVO: db_context_reader and
db_context_write that should be used instead of explicit
autonested_transaction / reader.using / writer.using in OVO context.

All neutron.objects.db.api helpers now receive OVO classes / objects
instead of model classes, since they need to know which type of engine
facade to use for which object. While it means we change signatures for
those helper functions, they are not used anywhere outside neutron tree
except vmware-nsx unit tests, and the latter pass anyway because the
tests completely mock out them disregarding their signatures.

This patch also adds several new OVO objects to be able to continue
using neutron.objects.db.api helpers to persist models that previously
didn't have corresponding OVO classes.

Finally, the patch adds registration for missing options in
neutron/tests/unit/extensions/test_qos_fip.py to be able to debug
failures in those unit tests. Strictly speaking, this change doesn't
belong to the patch, but I include it nevertheless to speed up merge in
time close to release.

There are several non-obvious changes included, specifically:

- in neutron.objects.base, decorator() that refreshes / expunges models
from the active session now opens a subtransaction for the whole span of
call / refresh / expunge, so that we can safely refresh model regardless
of whether caller opened another parent subtransaction (it was not the
case for create_subnetpool in base db plugin code).

- in neutron.db.l3_fip_qos, removed code that updates obj.db_model
relationship directly after corresponding insertions for child policy
binding model. This code is not needed because the only caller to the
_process_extra_fip_qos_update method refetches latest state of floating
ip OVO object anyway, and this code triggers several unit test failures.

- unit tests checking that a single commit happens for get_object and
get_objects are no longer valid for new facade objects that use reader
decorator that doesn't commit but close. This change is as intended, so
unit tests were tweaked to check close for new facade objects.

Change-Id: I15ec238c18a464f977f7d1079605b82965052311
Related-Bug: #1746996

commit_message:
Allow objects to opt in new engine facade

New facade is enabled by setting new_facade = True for the object of
interest. With new_facade on, all OVO actions will use the new reader /
writer decorator to activate sessions.

There are two new facade decorators added to OVO: db_context_reader and
db_context_write that should be used instead of explicit
autonested_transaction / reader.using / writer.using in OVO context.

All neutron.objects.db.api helpers now receive OVO classes / objects
instead of model classes, since they need to know which type of engine
facade to use for which object. While it means we change signatures for
those helper functions, they are not used anywhere outside neutron tree
except vmware-nsx unit tests, and the latter pass anyway because the
tests completely mock out them disregarding their signatures.

This patch also adds several new OVO objects to be able to continue
using neutron.objects.db.api helpers to persist models that previously
didn't have corresponding OVO classes.

Finally, the patch adds registration for missing options in
neutron/tests/unit/extensions/test_qos_fip.py to be able to debug
failures in those unit tests. Strictly speaking, this change doesn't
belong to the patch, but I include it nevertheless to speed up merge in
time close to release.

There are several non-obvious changes included, specifically:

- in neutron.objects.base, decorator() that refreshes / expunges models
from the active session now opens a subtransaction for the whole span of
call / refresh / expunge, so that we can safely refresh model regardless
of whether caller opened another parent subtransaction (it was not the
case for create_subnetpool in base db plugin code).

- in neutron.db.l3_fip_qos, removed code that updates obj.db_model
relationship directly after corresponding insertions for child policy
binding model. This code is not needed because the only caller to the
_process_extra_fip_qos_update method refetches latest state of floating
ip OVO object anyway, and this code triggers several unit test failures.

- unit tests checking that a single commit happens for get_object and
get_objects are no longer valid for new facade objects that use reader
decorator that doesn't commit but close. This change is as intended, so
unit tests were tweaked to check close for new facade objects.

Change-Id: I15ec238c18a464f977f7d1079605b82965052311
Related-Bug: #1746996

commit_message:
Decouple Image Import Plugin Opts

This change decouples Image Import Plugin Options from glance/opts.py
so that the deployer who wishes to add 3rd party plugin does not
need to inject the details to the file that is cluttered with all
Glance internal details.

Change-Id: Idc31dbb673efae224c97d2cafa4afa053e049c76
Closes-Bug: #1747926

commit_message:
Remove some unused parameters in parameters.yaml

There are no parameter maps to all_tenants, vol_type_id and user_id_1 in
parameters.yaml. So, remove these parameters. Besides, move volume_type
from path to body which is only used by api "Volume manage extension" in
body.

Change-Id: I717e3ab43aeed75e4d9a39f7df3d3c0a72c4aad0

commit_message:
Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

Change-Id: Ib527ac4df5a49511e1df85c5c99fe9fd419f5f9b

commit_message:
Update the Tempest plugin to point towards the new plugin

The Trove service has split it's tests for Tempest in a seperate
repo so this patch updates it.

This patch also fixes the lint issue to use the systemd module
reload feature instead of a command.

Closes-Bug: #1747608
Co-Authored-By: Major Hayden <major@mhtx.net>
Depends-On: I5f1ecb71c6125c29d6487bef6c2be215c1b561c1
Change-Id: I26d384a5c9aadade94052cc859f9405335635ed4

subject: Get ResourceGroup/Chain attributes from nested stack outputs
messages: [{'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2018-01-08 23:20:20.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2018-01-09 20:10:20.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2018-01-19 20:42:54.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2018-02-08 04:34:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:\n\ncheck experimental'}, {'account_id': 7385, 'date': '2018-02-08 15:54:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2018-02-09 05:40:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-08 23:20:20.000000000', 'message': "Get ResourceGroup/Chain attributes from nested stack outputs

Since Pike we've generated the templates for various nested stack resource
types with outputs that produce the attribute values that are referenced in
the parent stack, and a previous patch did the same for resource IDs. Use
these output values when available to calculate the attribute values. This
is efficient, because the all of the outputs are fetched together and
cached, and avoids using the grouputils functions that cause the nested
stack to get loaded into memory in the same process.

Fall back to the existing implementation (using grouputils) if the required
output isn't available (generally this would be due to the nested stack
being created on an earlier version of Heat that did not include the
outputs in the generated template, and not updated since).

Change-Id: I9146e1d99f494213daef7d61ae75c92a4ef981a9
Partial-Bug: #1731349
"}, {'created': '2018-01-09 20:10:20.000000000', 'message': "Get ResourceGroup/Chain attributes from nested stack outputs

Since Pike we've generated the templates for various nested stack resource
types with outputs that produce the attribute values that are referenced in

these output values when available to calculate the attribute values. This
is efficient, because the all of the outputs are fetched together and
cached, and avoids using the grouputils functions that cause the nested
stack to get loaded into memory in the same process.

Fall back to the existing implementation (using grouputils) if the required

being created on an earlier version of Heat that did not include the
outputs in the generated template, and not updated since).

Change-Id: I9146e1d99f494213daef7d61ae75c92a4ef981a9
Partial-Bug: #1731349
"}, {'created': '2018-01-19 20:42:54.000000000', 'message': "Get ResourceGroup/Chain attributes from nested stack outputs

Since Pike we've generated the templates for various nested stack resource
types with outputs that produce the attribute values that are referenced in
the parent stack, and a previous patch did the same for resource IDs. Use
these output values when available to calculate the attribute values. This
is efficient, because the all of the outputs are fetched together and
cached, and avoids using the grouputils functions that cause the nested
stack to get loaded into memory in the same process.

Fall back to the existing implementation (using grouputils) if the required
output isn't available (generally this would be due to the nested stack
being created on an earlier version of Heat that did not include the
outputs in the generated template, and not updated since).

Change-Id: I9146e1d99f494213daef7d61ae75c92a4ef981a9
Partial-Bug: #1731349
"}]
commit_message:
Get ResourceGroup/Chain attributes from nested stack outputs

Since Pike we've generated the templates for various nested stack resource
types with outputs that produce the attribute values that are referenced in
the parent stack, and a previous patch did the same for resource IDs. Use
these output values when available to calculate the attribute values. This
is efficient, because the all of the outputs are fetched together and
cached, and avoids using the grouputils functions that cause the nested
stack to get loaded into memory in the same process.

Fall back to the existing implementation (using grouputils) if the required
output isn't available (generally this would be due to the nested stack
being created on an earlier version of Heat that did not include the
outputs in the generated template, and not updated since).

Change-Id: I9146e1d99f494213daef7d61ae75c92a4ef981a9
Partial-Bug: #1731349

messages:
[{'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2018-02-07 20:12:19.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2018-02-08 01:23:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2018-02-08 06:05:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

recheck purge test failure'}, {'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2018-02-08 09:43:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 12404, 'date': '2018-02-09 04:57:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-07 20:12:19.000000000', 'message': "Handle data inconsistency in grouputils

In convergence, retrieving the template for a stack will return the latest
template submitted by the user and accepted to start a traversal. If this
template removes resources from the stack, they may continue to appear as
available when getting a list of current resources even if a definition
for them doesn't appear in the current template.

This occasionally caused a KeyError when trying to match up data from the
nested stack to the nested stack's template in grouputils using the
GroupInspector. Fix this by accounting for the fact that the stack and
template may contain different sets of resources.

Change-Id: I86d80ab766667194f4e6e3b6112d6b1b7a3733d8
Closes-Bug: #1747365
"}]
commit_message:
Handle data inconsistency in grouputils

In convergence, retrieving the template for a stack will return the latest
template submitted by the user and accepted to start a traversal. If this
template removes resources from the stack, they may continue to appear as
available when getting a list of current resources even if a definition
for them doesn't appear in the current template.

This occasionally caused a KeyError when trying to match up data from the
nested stack to the nested stack's template in grouputils using the
GroupInspector. Fix this by accounting for the fact that the stack and
template may contain different sets of resources.

Change-Id: I86d80ab766667194f4e6e3b6112d6b1b7a3733d8
Closes-Bug: #1747365

commit_message:
tests: test-glance-upgrades.sh: Remove the exit trap

We are already collecting logs as part of the post-run playbook so we
don't need to do that as part of the exit trap. This avoid collecting
and compressing the logs twice.

Change-Id: I3b4de14b2e98941c948bc23747b85a1a6286b272
(cherry picked from commit f0c7448fa22e1e35283e57ada4633a9263e671e0)

commit_message:
Adjust deprecated nova console variables

The `vncserver_listen` and `vncserver_proxyclient_address` variables
are now deprecated in queens. This patch updates those variables
to the new versions.

Closes-Bug: 1742705
Change-Id: Ibe2dfdb9c3c41a507c87d6ad34e6415a8a1e1cad

commit_message:
Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 308, 'name': 'Thierry Carrez', 'email': 'thierry@openstack.org', 'username': 'ttx'}, {'_account_id': 2874, 'name': 'yong sheng gong', 'email': 'gong.yongsheng@99cloud.net', 'username': 'gongysh'}, {'_account_id': 11904, 'name': 'Sean McGinnis', 'email': 'sean.mcginnis@gmail.com', 'username': 'SeanM'}, {'_account_id': 14288, 'name': 'Matthew Thode', 'display_name': 'prometheanfire', 'email': 'mthode@mthode.org', 'username': 'prometheanfire'}, {'_account_id': 21561, 'name': 'Anne Bertucio', 'email': 'annebertucio@gmail.com', 'username': 'whyhiannabelle'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 2874, 'date': '2018-02-07 05:24:11.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2018-02-07 10:39:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

At this point this should only be approved once we have a queens release request for tacker. No point in just adding the boilerplate header.'}, {'account_id': 2874, 'date': '2018-02-07 14:12:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I will release the tacker server soon after tacker client. thanks'}, {'account_id': 21561, 'date': '2018-02-07 17:58:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Would also request adding tacker cycle-highlights before approving'}, {'account_id': 2874, 'date': '2018-02-08 16:07:11.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-02-08 16:51:21.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-02-08 16:53:48.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Updated to include some new required settings we just recently added.

Gong, I am a little confused what is going on with the tacker release now with the client abandoned. Are you saying that was a client release to add a feature that hasn't even been added to the server side yet?

If you want us to proceed with this release, please acknowledge that here. I'm a little hesitant to approve this now not having a clear picture of the state of things.

And if you can add cycle-highlights like Anne requested, that would be great - though not a blocker."}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-02-08 23:09:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1'}, {'account_id': 2874, 'date': '2018-02-09 00:29:36.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 2874, 'date': '2018-02-09 00:34:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Sean,
https://docs.openstack.org/releasenotes/tacker/unreleased.html#id1
I have added these information into the cycle-hightlights


for client FRE release, since  there are concerns from release team, we decided not to release that feature in the queens cycle.'}, {'account_id': 14288, 'date': '2018-02-09 04:13:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 2874, 'date': '2018-02-09 04:21:20.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-02-09 06:54:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]

commit_message:
Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

Change-Id: Ie087d2d812b7937f2a1ac45dedb94559ff5113e6

commit_message:
Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

commit_message:
Replace random with SystemRandom for RandomString

it might be theoretically possible to infer the state of
standard Python's RNG in a long-running heat-engine service
from multiple created RandomString resources.

Let's use the random.SystemRandom (and os.urandom) for
OS::Heat::RandomString instead.

Change-Id: Iac5c03176fc8bae95ada883621196bd9cb453be3
Closes-Bug: #1745931

'}, {'created': '2018-02-07 08:51:37.000000000', 'message': 'Remove ikelifetime in %default section of ipsec.conf templates

commit_message:
Remove ikelifetime in %default section of ipsec.conf templates

Nowadays connections always override the ikelifetime setting in their
own sections. The setting in the %default section is no longer used. So
this commit removes that from the templates as a cleanup.

TrivialFix

[{'created': '2018-02-08 15:49:48.000000000', 'message': 'Fix wrong link for "Manage Flavors" in CPU topologies doc

The last sentence here where it links to "Manage Flavors"
is the wrong link. It goes here:
https://docs.openstack.org/nova/latest/admin/flavors.html which
doesn't talk about NUMA extra specs. It should be pointing at
the "NUMA topology" section of the flavor extra specs page:
https://docs.openstack.org/nova/latest/user/flavors.html#extra-specs-numa-topology

Conflicts:
      doc/source/user/flavors.rst

NOTE(mriedem): The conflict is due to a change in Queens
Ia57c93ef1e72ccf134ba6fc7fcb85ab228d68a47 which refactored
where the flavor docs live.

Change-Id: I30f6bc70afc5be00737cdf76e0e47bcb898a3a7f
Closes-Bug: #1747562
(cherry picked from commit 26de90a14d527ae18dd6cd39d4fdf589dd449fb6)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix wrong link for "Manage Flavors" in CPU topologies doc

The last sentence here where it links to "Manage Flavors"
is the wrong link. It goes here:
https://docs.openstack.org/nova/latest/admin/flavors.html which
doesn't talk about NUMA extra specs. It should be pointing at
the "NUMA topology" section of the flavor extra specs page:
https://docs.openstack.org/nova/latest/user/flavors.html#extra-specs-numa-topology

Conflicts:
      doc/source/user/flavors.rst

NOTE(mriedem): The conflict is due to a change in Queens
Ia57c93ef1e72ccf134ba6fc7fcb85ab228d68a47 which refactored
where the flavor docs live.

Change-Id: I30f6bc70afc5be00737cdf76e0e47bcb898a3a7f
Closes-Bug: #1747562
(cherry picked from commit 26de90a14d527ae18dd6cd39d4fdf589dd449fb6)

commit_message:
Add test for resetting volume's attach status

The API that reset status of volume in fact supports to reset volume's
status, attach_status and migration_status. This patch adds test case
for resetting volume's attach status.

Change-Id: I214b63587648b4ae181e62d497a32ad0f4d8831e

commit_message:
Remove deprecated sync_db options

The sync_db option has been deprecated in Ocata[1].
we can remove it.

[1]https://review.openstack.org/#/c/408161/

Change-Id: I35898b6c298c864a76e05b41322fc61d75244c0d

subject: Make heat parameter plugin_dirs configurable
messages: [{'account_id': 18343, 'date': '2018-02-06 19:03:54.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 1004, 'date': '2018-02-07 15:22:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2018-02-09 03:21:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-06 19:03:54.000000000', 'message': 'Make heat parameter plugin_dirs configurable

Heat has an additional configuration for plugin_dirs
parameter. This parameter provides a list of directories
to search for plug-ins. This change allows configuration
of plugin_dirs parameter in heat.conf file. This change
will allow a user to set this value, if required. Else
$::os_service_default will be used and the parameter will
not be added to the config file, as it is done today.

Change-Id: I636d52f867ee447eaf0e1e80bf9fdc30c91f4ec1
(cherry picked from commit 56cbd7c89bfc99f6a962319f478d75dbf35e8335)
'}]
commit_message:
Make heat parameter plugin_dirs configurable

Heat has an additional configuration for plugin_dirs
parameter. This parameter provides a list of directories
to search for plug-ins. This change allows configuration
of plugin_dirs parameter in heat.conf file. This change
will allow a user to set this value, if required. Else
$::os_service_default will be used and the parameter will
not be added to the config file, as it is done today.

Change-Id: I636d52f867ee447eaf0e1e80bf9fdc30c91f4ec1
(cherry picked from commit 56cbd7c89bfc99f6a962319f478d75dbf35e8335)

Correct reading way
https://docs.openstack.org/sahara/latest/admin/advanced-configuration-guide.html'}, {'account_id': 27577, 'date': '2018-01-10 07:01:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> Correct reading way
 > https://docs.openstack.org/sahara/latest/admin/advanced-configuration-guide.html

I mean install guide, not advanced configuration guide'}, {'account_id': 27577, 'date': '2018-01-10 07:02:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> Correct reading way
 > https://docs.openstack.org/sahara/latest/admin/advanced-configuration-guide.html

../install/installation-guide.html can not be found.'}, {'account_id': 10459, 'date': '2018-01-10 11:28:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Can you please explain where do you see the error? The link works on the generated site, as caowei pointed out.'}, {'account_id': 27577, 'date': '2018-01-10 11:38:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> Can you please explain where do you see the error? The link works
 > on the generated site, as caowei pointed out.

https://github.com/openstack/sahara/blob/master/doc/source/admin/advanced-configuration-guide.rst, `To run sahara in distributed mode pick several hosts on which you want to run sahara services and follow these steps:`, here is a link ref to `install guide`, click it returns not found'}, {'account_id': 10459, 'date': '2018-01-10 11:43:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

That's expected: this is a source document; you should refer to the generated documentation."}, {'account_id': 10459, 'date': '2018-01-10 11:44:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(also, github is a mirror, and it is just a possible rendered of rst file; the main repository is git.openstack.org).

Please refer to docs.openstack.org. If you want to test your change to the documentation, you can regenerate it locally with tox -e docs.'}, {'account_id': 10459, 'date': '2018-01-10 11:45:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(a final note: even if this was a real problem - which is not - then this review would have not been good anyway; all the links should have been fixed.)'}, {'account_id': 10459, 'date': '2018-02-02 15:36:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

ping, is it clear the reason why the patch is not required? Can we abandon this?'}, {'account_id': 27577, 'date': '2018-02-09 03:42:12.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

- gate-tripleo-specs-python27-ubuntu-xenial http://logs.openstack.org/09/421009/18/check/gate-tripleo-specs-python27-ubuntu-xenial/4abc2b5/ : SUCCESS in 3m 09s'}, {'account_id': 24245, 'date': '2017-03-28 20:55:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 18:

(1 comment)

Overall I think this looks good.

One thing I thought about while working on is masqurading on the undercloud. Would we have to add support to masqurade the routed networks? Or should we just add documentation that masqurading is not supported when doing routed networks deployment?'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2017-06-20 15:23:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 18: Code-Review-1

Dan, please move it to Queens at this stage, unless you can show so real progress in Pike cycle. Thanks!'}, {'account_id': 24245, 'date': '2017-06-20 15:44:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 18:

During the last couple of weeks we got some important pices merged i Neutron for this.
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/470788/
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/459861/
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/468744/

The undercloud changes to do the ironic inspector as well as configuring the routed networks for provisioning network is quite complete:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/437544/

The controlplane changes to tht is here:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/473817/

I belive the tht change will require the change in heat to avoid replacing the current port on updates. If the port is replaced I belive ipam would become out of sync.

I would like to give this a bit more time before we move it too queens.'}, {'account_id': 12398, 'date': '2017-06-20 21:56:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 18:

Harald, moving this spec to Queens doesn't mean that we have to stop working in Pike, but it does mean that we don't need to complete all the moving pieces in Pike. I don't think we will be able to get all the updates we need in Heat and Neutron in time for us to implement all the features in the undercloud needed to do the full deploy, as well as proper testing and documentation. So my thinking is we move the implementation date to Queens 1 for now, and continue to complete as many parts as possible in Pike 3."}, {'account_id': 24245, 'date': '2018-01-17 10:53:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 18:

(8 comments)

Many of the problems discussed in this spec has been solved. The spec proposes several alternative approches to each problem. Since this was first proposed features such a composable networks where implemented which in many cases is one of the suggested solutions.

I wonder if it makes sense to make an update and remove the possible solutions and keep the one implemented?'}, {'account_id': 12398, 'date': '2018-01-17 19:01:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 18:

(16 comments)

Harald, thanks for the comments. I mistakenly thought you were going to take a pass at updating this doc, but with your comments I can do another revision.'}, {'account_id': 12398, 'date': '2018-01-27 01:47:48.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 19.'}, {'account_id': 24245, 'date': '2018-01-29 10:17:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 19: Code-Review+1

Thanks Dan. Looks good to me.'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2018-02-07 16:55:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 19: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2018-02-09 03:26:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 19: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-01-17 01:45:16.000000000', 'message': 'Spec: tripleo-routed-networks-deployment - Routed Spine and Leaf

This spec covers the scope of work required to enable deployment of TripleO
in a routed network environment. A routed network design, also known as
"Spine and Leaf", or "Clos" architecture, allows for horizontal scalability
where each group of servers is inside its own set of layer 2 subnets, and
subnets are connected via routers. This allows for a larger number of total
nodes, since the broadcast, multicast, and unknown unicast (BUM traffic) is
isolated to the local layer 2 domain. Furthermore, equal-cost multipath
(ECMP) can provide better distribution of traffic between multiple uplinks
in large deployments.

There are multiple projects which will need to be enhanced to add features
for routed newtorks. The DHCP services provided by both Neutron and Ironic
Inspector need to be enhanced to provide routers for each subnet. The use
of Neutron as an IP address management (IPAM) backend will need to be
evaluated, to determine if we need features that were added to support
routed networks in Neutron. The TripleO Heat templates will need to be
refactored in order to support multiple subnets. We may need some
enhancements to os-net-config (to be determined).

This spec attempts to break down the overall goals by the problem set as
it applies to each project. Separate blueprints and specs will be used
for each separate project or dependency, the blueprint associated with
this spec will be used to link to them all.

Change-Id: I72861ce8adfeff67b894cf389f7096cde8be9258
'}, {'created': '2017-01-17 17:29:41.000000000', 'message': 'Spec: tripleo-routed-networks-deployment - Routed Spine and Leaf

in a routed network environment. A routed network design, also known as
"Spine and Leaf", or "Clos" architecture, allows for horizontal scalability
where each group of servers is inside its own set of layer 2 subnets, and
subnets are connected via routers. This allows for a larger number of total
nodes, since the broadcast, multicast, and unknown unicast (BUM traffic) is
isolated to the local layer 2 domain. Furthermore, equal-cost multipath
(ECMP) can provide better distribution of traffic between multiple uplinks
in large deployments.

There are multiple projects which will need to be enhanced to add features
for routed newtorks. The DHCP services provided by both Neutron and Ironic
Inspector need to be enhanced to provide routers for each subnet. The use
of Neutron as an IP address management (IPAM) backend will need to be
evaluated, to determine if we need features that were added to support
routed networks in Neutron. The TripleO Heat templates will need to be
refactored in order to support multiple subnets. We may need some
enhancements to os-net-config (to be determined).

This spec attempts to break down the overall goals by the problem set as
it applies to each project. Separate blueprints and specs will be used
for each separate project or dependency, all depenent on this one.

Implements blueprint: tripleo-routed-networks-deployment

Change-Id: I72861ce8adfeff67b894cf389f7096cde8be9258
