commit_message:
blueprint tripleo-routed-networks-deployment

Spec: tripleo-routed-networks-deployment - Routed Spine and Leaf

This spec covers the scope of work required to enable deployment of TripleO
in a routed network environment. A routed network design that uses a
"Spine and Leaf", or "Clos" architecture, allows for horizontal scalability
where each group of servers is inside its own set of layer 2 subnets, and
subnets are connected via routers. This allows for a larger number of total
nodes, since the broadcast, multicast, and unknown unicast (BUM traffic) is
isolated to the local layer 2 domain. Furthermore, equal-cost multipath
(ECMP) can provide better distribution of traffic between multiple uplinks
in large deployments.

There are multiple projects which will need to be enhanced to add features
for routed newtorks. The DHCP services provided by both Neutron and Ironic
Inspector need to be enhanced to provide routers for each subnet. The use
of Neutron as an IP address management (IPAM) backend will need to be
evaluated, to determine if we need features that were added to support
routed networks in Neutron. The TripleO Heat templates will need to be
refactored in order to support multiple subnets. We may need some
enhancements to os-net-config (to be determined).

This spec attempts to break down the overall goals by the problem set as
it applies to each project. Separate specs will be used
for each separate project or dependency, all depenent on this one.

This spec is related to the following:

blueprint tripleo-predictable-ctlplane-ips
blueprint tripleo-routed-networks-ironic-inspector
blueprint tripleo-routed-networks-templates

Change-Id: I72861ce8adfeff67b894cf389f7096cde8be9258

subject: Release zun-tempest-plugin 1.0.0
messages:
[{'account_id': 11536, 'date': '2018-02-03 03:16:43.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-02-03 14:18:24.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

This needs a release job specified in openstack-infra/project-config/zuul.d/projects.yaml:

openstack-infra/project-config/zuul.d/projects.yaml no release job specified for openstack/zun-tempest-plugin, one of ['release-openstack-server', 'publish-to-pypi'] needs to be included in ['system-required', 'check-requirements', 'publish-openstack-sphinx-docs', 'tempest-plugin-jobs'] or no release will be published

and will require the line tarball-base in the deliverable file:

tarball-base for openstack/zun-tempest-plugin 1.0.0 defaults to 'zun-tempest-plugin' but the sdist name is actually 'zun_tempest_plugin'. It is too expensive to determine this value during the site build, please set it explicitly.

http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/releases/tree/README.rst#n498"}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-02-04 01:31:48.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

I thought part of the point of moving these plugins out of the main tree was that we wouldn't be branching them?"}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-02-04 13:05:10.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I haven't seen this explicitly stated one way or the other, but we should clarify this policy before we do anything.

It is a good point that tempest itself is not branched, so it would seem a little odd to me to branch the plugins."}, {'account_id': 11536, 'date': '2018-02-04 15:53:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Published edit on patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 11536, 'date': '2018-02-04 15:58:13.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Before the tempest split, we used to backport patches along with the tests to stable branch. If right now the splitted out plugin doesn't have branches, I expect there will be a little overhead on backport but it is still workable."}, {'account_id': 11536, 'date': '2018-02-04 16:00:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

So my default position is to create the stable branches but I can live without them.'}, {'account_id': 11536, 'date': '2018-02-04 20:18:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Published edit on patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2018-02-06 04:27:55.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Yeah I'm pretty sure branching tempest plugins isn't desired.  Tempest is branchless therefore plugins shoudl also be branchl;ess.  It isn't explicit in [1] but bullet point 2 implies it to my mind


[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/queens/split-tempest-plugins.html"}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2018-02-06 04:29:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Adding Matt and Andrea from a QA perspective.'}, {'account_id': 5196, 'date': '2018-02-06 04:36:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Yeah, you do **not** want to branch plugins. One of the key reasons we pushed the plugin split goal is because the release model of the plugins really should match the project those plugins are adding on to. As Tony pointed out a lot of the issues with a branched in tree plugin are caused by friction caused by using a different release model from tempest itself. Also generally speaking branchless API testing is a good thing because you're using the same API tests across a release boundary to ensure the API is consistent between releases.

Releases are fine though as they provide an easy consumable for downstream use and something you can publish on pypi. But, you don't want ever really want to branch a tempest plugin, especially on an "OpenStack" release boundary.'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-02-06 18:50:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review-2

Blocking per Tony and Matt's response."}, {'account_id': 11536, 'date': '2018-02-08 02:47:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

> Blocking per Tony and Matt's response.

Matt's response also mentioned that release is fine, right. This is what the latest patchset proposes. I guess."}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-02-08 17:50:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2

Sorry, I mixed up. Looks fine.'}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2018-02-09 03:14:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-08 16:37:01.000000000', 'message': "Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/queens

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the
requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

Change-Id: I62639f1970a895da2cec28eb50e506293cbc5013
"}]
commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/queens

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the
requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

Change-Id: I62639f1970a895da2cec28eb50e506293cbc5013

commit_message:
[DNM] Run BFV job for a nova change to get volume connector IP

The nova change for getting a volume connector IP address affects the
deploy sequence of ironic virt driver. This patch is used to run
ironic jobs with the nova change.

Change-Id: If02cff40e3fea329a6238d2f5564d9862a7c0eac
Depends-On: I999bbfc0e28ec43390298deb59e2b6f6e10bf8ea

commit_message:
Change note for version/release from releasenotes

Release notes are version independent, so remove version/release values.
We've found that most projects now require the service package to be
installed in order to build release notes, and this is entirely due to
the current convention of pulling in the version information.

Release notes should not need installation in order to build, so this
unnecessary version setting needs to be removed.

This patch propose to change the note, so people won't try to use it.

Change-Id: I16110bb3951bd5bf9e644bbcd7b35b1f610ab909

Compute RPC client bump to 5.0

This adds the usual compatibility logic for allowing 5.0 and 4.x for a
version-spanning release. This also adds a queens version alias.

subject: Quarantine DB without *_stat row
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 2622, 'name': 'Samuel Merritt', 'email': 'sam@swiftstack.com', 'username': 'torgomatic'}, {'_account_id': 7233, 'name': 'Matthew Oliver', 'email': 'matt@oliver.net.au', 'username': 'mattoliverau'}, {'_account_id': 13052, 'name': 'SwiftStack Cluster CI', 'email': 'openstack-ci@swiftstack.com', 'username': 'swiftstack-cluster-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 15343, 'name': 'Tim Burke', 'email': 'tburke@nvidia.com', 'username': 'tburke'}, {'_account_id': 16896, 'name': 'OndÅej NovÃ½', 'email': 'novy@ondrej.org', 'username': 'onovy'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 27552, 'name': 'guozj', 'email': 'guozj@awcloud.com', 'username': 'guozj'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 16896, 'date': '2018-02-06 12:09:31.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 16896, 'date': '2018-02-06 15:09:55.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 16896, 'date': '2018-02-06 19:26:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2018-02-06 20:22:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2

(1 comment)

Tests (functional & unit) pass locally, and backing out the changes to db.py result in the expected

 'NoneType' object has no attribute '__getitem__'

error. Longer term, we should probably wrap everything in create_container_info_table (or even all of _initialize) in a transaction, similar to what we do in _migrate_add_storage_policy."}, {'account_id': 2622, 'date': '2018-02-06 21:38:19.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

We're assuming this is corruption and not a failed migration of an old database, right?"}, {'account_id': 16896, 'date': '2018-02-07 15:04:13.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2018-02-07 15:59:46.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2

I think it'll still be worth figuring out how we got here, and the harder I look, the more confused I get about what went wrong :-/

But regardless, we'll need to be able to recover from it. Still looks good to me."}, {'account_id': 16896, 'date': '2018-02-07 18:35:18.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2018-02-07 19:05:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 7233, 'date': '2018-02-08 00:26:09.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Code-Review+1

(1 comment)

Seeing as your touching a bunch of code that looks the same, I wonder if this is a good chance to refactor it a little... see inline.

Though maybe I'll just push it as a follow up patch :)

Looks good, I want to do some testing before a +2."}, {'account_id': 27552, 'date': '2018-02-08 00:56:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 2622, 'date': '2018-02-09 00:28:40.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2

I'd still like to know more about how the database got in this state, but since it could be a bug in Swift, Python's sqlite3 module, SQLite, or (improbably but still possibly) Linux, I'm fine with merging the fix now and looking for root causes later.

If this isn't some highly-improbably one-off event, then there will be other such busted DBs out there, and we'd better be able to quarantime them."}]

subject: Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/queens
messages: [{'account_id': 14107, 'date': '2018-02-09 01:08:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-08 23:40:34.000000000', 'message': "Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/queens

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the
requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

Change-Id: I0415d64be07b75d0da925067679f2f2201fe95c0
"}]
commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/queens

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the
requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

Change-Id: I0415d64be07b75d0da925067679f2f2201fe95c0

commit_message:
Bump compute RPC API to version 5.0

This moves us to version 5.0, with a proxy for 4.x for Queens. This includes
a lot of churn due to a lot of kwarg cruft. This is all just refactor, as it
doesn't include the client side change. So if this passes, we know we're
compatible, and subsequent patches will add client-side support.

Change-Id: I539b0a439030be57fd03012526ff0236f2b88a4e

commit_message:
Enable hacking-extensions H204, H205

This patch enable extensions:
- H204: Use assert(Not)Equal to check for equality.
- H205: Use assert(Greater|Less)(Equal) for comparison.

Change-Id: I2db8cbbfda6d57321372fb3d1238d3f9fb05545a

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-08 23:40:26.000000000', 'message': "Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/queens

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the
requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

Change-Id: I6c4e059da76853a2934683fd58f9ae0c78d7de00
"}]
commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/queens

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the
requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

Change-Id: I6c4e059da76853a2934683fd58f9ae0c78d7de00

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-06 09:24:25.000000000', 'message': 'Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

Change-Id: Ic9310f8a48ebe25a9f52486b10d5fdb9ae5ac68f
'}]
commit_message:
Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

Change-Id: Ic9310f8a48ebe25a9f52486b10d5fdb9ae5ac68f

commit_message:
Add safe_for_db_retry decorator

dbapi update methods that happen under the lock can be safely retried
if, for example, DB connection is lost. It is not the case for the
create methods (as retries can cause duplicate entries) and delete
methods (as they can cause not found exceptions). This change adds
safe_for_db_retry to all related methods.

Change-Id: I49857e293140f174f7482259b9960bdb36fab6f8

commit_message:
Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

Change-Id: I52d367e5ae29f33c17287ec745387d115f24d8ac

commit_message:
searchlight-ui rc2

The rc1 build failed to upload to PyPI for reasons unrelated to the
code in the repository. The most straightforward way to ensure we have
a good release candidate published is to tag another one, using the
same SHA as for the previous one.

Change-Id: Idebe7fdd6640ad3c346b4fca568b05982206fd2c
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

subject: Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/queens
messages: [{'account_id': 5202, 'date': '2018-02-08 21:31:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-08 21:09:42.000000000', 'message': "Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/queens

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the
requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

Change-Id: I6ac0eec0e98effe8f7e6643337fc68cc0114020f
"}]
commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/queens

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the
requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

Change-Id: I6ac0eec0e98effe8f7e6643337fc68cc0114020f

commit_message:
Do not generate apache/haproxy certs for invalid networks

Certs were being generated for all networks in service net map.
This was failing as we do not generate hieradata for all of these networks.

Switching from yaql to jinga templating to match the logic that
generates the hieradata.

Change-Id: Ic6c25aceb07ea3824a8fb23549bc5d1205e5cefc
Closes-bug: 1748023
Closes-Bug: 1748053

In general, if we are going support soft deletes (which I like), then we will also need some kind of manual cleanup option. For example, let's say you try and delete domain "Fred". We make it as deleted, but form some reason we fail to actually to teh final physical removal. The domain entry (with its unique domain name intact) will still be lying around, which would mean if you then tried to create a new domain called "Fred" it would fail - and it would not be obvious why. Maybe we add an option to the cli tool to clean up and orphaned entities that can be soft deleted?'}, {'account_id': 8482, 'date': '2018-02-02 15:57:25.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 8482, 'date': '2018-02-02 15:58:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 8482, 'date': '2018-02-02 16:42:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 8482, 'date': '2018-02-04 19:03:55.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9.'}, {'account_id': 8482, 'date': '2018-02-04 19:04:51.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 10.'}, {'account_id': 8482, 'date': '2018-02-05 08:36:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 8482, 'date': '2018-02-05 08:54:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 8482, 'date': '2018-02-05 22:31:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 10:

I think this approach is going to be a lot more involved than I originally thought. Every manager method that gets or lists users, groups, roles, role assignments, projects, or domain_config must check that the domain exists before admitting that an object exists. And any future domain-specific features we add will have to do the same. In some cases this means calling resource_api.get_domain and wrapping the DomainNotFound with XNotFound. Some actions, such as list_users, don't already fetch the domain so this would be an added step. For role assignments these are pretty much pulled directly from the database so we'd have to check every user, group, role, project, and domain in the assignment map which will majorly impact performance. Disabling a domain does not go nearly this far so we don't have an existing model for this. This is going to become very brittle and susceptible to mistakes. I'm inclined to backtrack this to what I had in patchset 5. It's not atomic, but it will almost always work, which is better than the current situation where it never works, and better than this direction where it might seem to work and actually have opened up vulnerabilities."}, {'account_id': 8482, 'date': '2018-02-06 16:33:36.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 11.'}, {'account_id': 8482, 'date': '2018-02-06 16:33:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 2218, 'date': '2018-02-06 17:06:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11: Code-Review+2

Domain is a required entity for user entries in the table.  This is the wrong way to address the problem.  There are very few FK constraints in Keystone, but this is one  that should remain.'}, {'account_id': 2218, 'date': '2018-02-06 17:06:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11: Code-Review-2'}, {'account_id': 8482, 'date': '2018-02-06 18:04:46.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 11:

> Domain is a required entity for user entries in the table.  This is
 > the wrong way to address the problem.  There are very few FK
 > constraints in Keystone, but this is one  that should remain.

What if we made sure it was properly enforced at the manager layer?

This is the only constraint that crosses driver boundaries, it's frustrating that it exists because it means the resource driver can never be an out-of-tree driver."}, {'account_id': 2218, 'date': '2018-02-06 19:54:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11:

Out of tree driver should be OK so long as it is domain specific.  I would not want the domain management to go out of tree.'}, {'account_id': 8482, 'date': '2018-02-06 23:05:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 11:

This passes tempest and grenade. The domain_id property isn't being represented as a foreign key in the sqlalchemy model so keystone isn't even internally enforcing it and the enforcement at the db level doesn't seem to be required."}, {'account_id': 8482, 'date': '2018-02-06 23:11:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11:

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 2218, 'date': '2018-02-06 23:53:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 11: -Code-Review

I'll abide by the preference of the other cores, but feel like this is not necessary."}, {'account_id': 8482, 'date': '2018-02-07 14:33:58.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 12.'}, {'account_id': 8482, 'date': '2018-02-07 14:35:19.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 12:

This was meant to just be a crazy experiment but now that it doesn't (seem to) break things I'm curious if other reviewers think this is too far off the rails."}, {'account_id': 8482, 'date': '2018-02-07 16:54:19.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 13.'}, {'account_id': 8482, 'date': '2018-02-07 20:08:19.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 14.'}, {'account_id': 5046, 'date': '2018-02-07 21:30:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 14:

I want to make sure we don't undo part of a picture we're not completely seeing."}, {'account_id': 8482, 'date': '2018-02-07 22:02:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 14:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 5707, 'date': '2018-02-08 12:28:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 14: Code-Review-1

So I'm also a little concerned about dropping the FK (...and if we did decide to go ahead, we should drop to for groups too). I *thought* our agreement was that while we know know that some user/group backends may not be SQL, if it was SQL then we only support SQL for resources (hence the FK was safe)."}, {'account_id': 8482, 'date': '2018-02-08 12:39:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 14:

> So I'm also a little concerned about dropping the FK (...and if we
 > did decide to go ahead, we should drop to for groups too). I
 > *thought* our agreement was that while we know know that some
 > user/group backends may not be SQL, if it was SQL then we only
 > support SQL for resources (hence the FK was safe).

At the time the foreign key was added, we hadn't declared the resource driver to be SQL only. In the process of working through other issues Morgan discovered the foreign key was causing problems and retroactively declared the resource driver SQL only (https://review.openstack.org/#/c/493621/). But I don't think that really excuses it, and we're still seeing problems with it, even when all drivers are SQL."}, {'account_id': 8482, 'date': '2018-02-08 19:29:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 14:

Re dropping for groups - there actually isn't one for groups

mysql> show create table `group`;
<snip>
| group | CREATE TABLE `group` (
  `id` varchar(64) NOT NULL,
  `domain_id` varchar(64) NOT NULL,
  `name` varchar(64) NOT NULL,
  `description` text,
  `extra` text,
  PRIMARY KEY (`id`),
  UNIQUE KEY `ixu_group_name_domain_id` (`domain_id`,`name`)
) ENGINE=InnoDB DEFAULT CHARSET=utf8 |

It wasn't added originally and it wasn't part of the migration that added it to users https://github.com/openstack/keystone/blob/2bd88d3/keystone/common/sql/expand_repo/versions/014_expand_add_domain_id_to_user_table.py#L140-L141"}, {'account_id': 5046, 'date': '2018-02-08 19:38:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 14:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 8482, 'date': '2018-02-08 20:19:11.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 15.'}, {'account_id': 8482, 'date': '2018-02-08 20:21:24.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 15:

Reverting this to my original idea: this now adds a new notification that happens right before deleting the domain. Adam hates this, Henry is uneasy about it, Morgan is worried about rolling upgrades. Rather than merge something risky this close to the release, let's get a workaround in for now. I would like to revisit this during Rocky after the ansible rolling upgrade job is fixed."}, {'account_id': 5046, 'date': '2018-02-08 20:21:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 15: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 2903, 'date': '2018-02-08 21:06:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 15: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2

(1 comment)'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-30 22:29:15.000000000', 'message': "Delete SQL users before deleting domain

Since the users table has a foreign key to the projects table[1], users
must be deleted before the domain can be deleted. However, the
notification emitted from the domain deletion comes too late, and
keystone runs into a foreign key reference error before it can delete
the users. This patch addresses the problem by adding a new internal
notification to alert the identity manager that users should be deleted.
This uses a new notification rather than the existing notification
because the existing one is used to alert listeners that the domain
deletion has been fully completed, whereas this one must happen in the
middle of the domain delete process.

The callback must also only try to delete SQL users. The LDAP driver
doesn't support deleting users, and we can't assume other drivers
support it either. Moreover, the foreign key reference is only a problem
for SQL users anyway.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/keystone/blob/2bd88d3/keystone/common/sql/expand_repo/versions/014_expand_add_domain_id_to_user_table.py#L140-L141

Change-Id: If5bdb6f5eef80b50b000aed5188ce7da4dfd1083
Closes-bug: #1718747

'}, {'created': '2018-02-04 19:03:55.000000000', 'message': 'Annotate domain before deleting

Since the users table has a foreign key to the projects table[1], users
must be deleted before the domain can be deleted. However, the
notification emitted from the domain deletion comes too late, and
keystone runs into a foreign key reference error before it can delete
the users. This patch addresses the problem by turning domain deletion
into a two-phase process. In phase 1, domains are marked as "deleted"
in a new table column. From a user-facing perspective, projects, users
and groups contained in the domain are then also considered deleted. In
phase 2, resources are physically deleted from the database and the
domain is finally deleted as well. In order to account for the
possibility that an interruption could occur between a resource being
marked as deleted and the physical deletion, a new keystone-manage
command is introduced to clean up cruft.

The 'deleted' column is added to the project table and there is no
enforcement that it be applied only to domains and not regular projects.
Internally to keystone, only domains ever get marked as deleted. Since
the project schema uses 'additionalProperties' to allow arbitrary
setting of properties, a user could set a project or domain as 'deleted'
even though this is not an advertised part of the API. There's no real
need to prevent them from doing this, but this patch does ensure that
they cannot reverse a deletion. The 'deleted' property is not exposed
when a resource is returned to a user.

Because our backend unit tests run with SQLite and foreign keys do not
work properly, we can't properly expose the foreign reference bug in our
unit tests, but there is an accompanying tempest test[2][3] to validate
this fix.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/keystone/blob/2bd88d3/keystone/common/sql/expand_repo/versions/014_expand_add_domain_id_to_user_table.py#L140-L141
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/509610
[3] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/509947

Change-Id: If5bdb6f5eef80b50b000aed5188ce7da4dfd1083
Closes-bug: #1718747
'}, {'created': '2018-02-04 19:04:51.000000000', 'message': 'Annotate domain before deleting

Since the users table has a foreign key to the projects table[1], users
must be deleted before the domain can be deleted. However, the
notification emitted from the domain deletion comes too late, and
keystone runs into a foreign key reference error before it can delete
the users. This patch addresses the problem by turning domain deletion
into a two-phase process. In phase 1, domains are marked as "deleted"
in a new table column. From a user-facing perspective, projects, users
and groups contained in the domain are then also considered deleted. In
phase 2, resources are physically deleted from the database and the
domain is finally deleted as well. In order to account for the
possibility that an interruption could occur between a resource being
marked as deleted and the physical deletion, a new keystone-manage
command is introduced to clean up cruft.

The 'deleted' column is added to the project table and there is no
enforcement that it be applied only to domains and not regular projects.
Internally to keystone, only domains ever get marked as deleted. Since
the project schema uses 'additionalProperties' to allow arbitrary
setting of properties, a user could set a project or domain as 'deleted'
even though this is not an advertised part of the API. There's no real
need to prevent them from doing this, but this patch does ensure that
they cannot reverse a deletion. The 'deleted' property is not exposed
when a resource is returned to a user.

Because our backend unit tests run with SQLite and foreign keys do not
work properly, we can't properly expose the foreign reference bug in our
unit tests, but there is an accompanying tempest test[2][3] to validate
this fix.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/keystone/blob/2bd88d3/keystone/common/sql/expand_repo/versions/014_expand_add_domain_id_to_user_table.py#L140-L141
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/509610
[3] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/509947

Change-Id: If5bdb6f5eef80b50b000aed5188ce7da4dfd1083
Closes-bug: #1718747
'}, {'created': '2018-02-06 16:33:36.000000000', 'message': 'Drop domain id foreign key from user table

How badly does this break things?

[1] https://github.com/openstack/keystone/blob/2bd88d3/keystone/common/sql/expand_repo/versions/014_expand_add_domain_id_to_user_table.py#L140-L141
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/509610
[3] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/509947

Change-Id: If5bdb6f5eef80b50b000aed5188ce7da4dfd1083
Closes-bug: #1718747
'}, {'created': '2018-02-07 14:33:58.000000000', 'message': "Drop domain id foreign key from user table

A foreign key was added between the user and project table as part of
ensuring that users of all types had an associated domain[1]. The
foreign key was never added to the sql model and so wasn't ever enforced
in the application layer, only in the database layer. Having it in the
database layer causes a server error when trying to delete a domain that
contains users because it breaks the foreign key reference. Since the
foreign key isn't providing any value and domain membership is enforced
at the manager layer, remove the foreign key from the user table.

Because our backend unit tests run with SQLite and foreign keys do not
work properly, we can't properly expose the foreign reference bug in our
unit tests, but there is an accompanying tempest test[2][3] to validate
this fix.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/keystone/blob/2bd88d3/keystone/common/sql/expand_repo/versions/014_expand_add_domain_id_to_user_table.py#L140-L141

foreign key was never added to the sql model and so wasn't ever enforced
in the application layer, only in the database layer. Having it in the

contains users because it breaks the foreign key reference. Since the
foreign key isn't providing any value and domain membership is enforced
at the manager layer, remove the foreign key from the user table.

Because our backend unit tests run with SQLite and foreign keys do not
work properly, we can't properly expose the foreign reference bug in our
unit tests, but there is an accompanying tempest test[2][3] to validate
this fix.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/keystone/blob/2bd88d3/keystone/common/sql/expand_repo/versions/014_expand_add_domain_id_to_user_table.py#L140-L141

Closes-bug: #1718747
"}, {'created': '2018-02-08 20:19:11.000000000', 'message': "Delete SQL users before deleting domain

Since the users table has a foreign key to the projects table[1], users
must be deleted before the domain can be deleted. However, the
notification emitted from the domain deletion comes too late, and
keystone runs into a foreign key reference error before it can delete
the users. This patch addresses the problem by adding a new internal
notification to alert the identity manager that users should be deleted.
This uses a new notification rather than the existing notification
because the existing one is used to alert listeners that the domain
deletion has been fully completed, whereas this one must happen in the
middle of the domain delete process.

The callback must also only try to delete SQL users. The LDAP driver
doesn't support deleting users, and we can't assume other drivers
support it either. Moreover, the foreign key reference is only a problem
for SQL users anyway.

Because our backend unit tests run with SQLite and foreign keys do not
work properly, we can't properly expose this bug in our unit tests, but
there is an accompanying tempest test[2][3] to validate this fix.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/keystone/blob/2bd88d3/keystone/common/sql/expand_repo/versions/014_expand_add_domain_id_to_user_table.py#L140-L141
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/509610
[3] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/509947

Change-Id: If5bdb6f5eef80b50b000aed5188ce7da4dfd1083
Closes-bug: #1718747
"}]
commit_message:
Delete SQL users before deleting domain

Since the users table has a foreign key to the projects table[1], users
must be deleted before the domain can be deleted. However, the
notification emitted from the domain deletion comes too late, and
keystone runs into a foreign key reference error before it can delete
the users. This patch addresses the problem by adding a new internal
notification to alert the identity manager that users should be deleted.
This uses a new notification rather than the existing notification
because the existing one is used to alert listeners that the domain
deletion has been fully completed, whereas this one must happen in the
middle of the domain delete process.

The callback must also only try to delete SQL users. The LDAP driver
doesn't support deleting users, and we can't assume other drivers
support it either. Moreover, the foreign key reference is only a problem
for SQL users anyway.

Because our backend unit tests run with SQLite and foreign keys do not
work properly, we can't properly expose this bug in our unit tests, but
there is an accompanying tempest test[2][3] to validate this fix.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/keystone/blob/2bd88d3/keystone/common/sql/expand_repo/versions/014_expand_add_domain_id_to_user_table.py#L140-L141
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/509610
[3] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/509947

Change-Id: If5bdb6f5eef80b50b000aed5188ce7da4dfd1083
Closes-bug: #1718747

commit_message:
Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

Change-Id: I1000f9d0678774ad13f41cf0d7c10d035e9b8240

commit_message:
Fix for proper deployment when keystone enabled and minimal OS

Due to the fact that the openstack CLI can not be found on
the minimal OS (Ubuntu Xenial + OpenSSH server ~ 363 packages)
and that some tasks related to Keystone use this utility
it should be installed like the other Ironic CLIs

Change-Id: I3c2056cd1fe8551ca7dcb7f122e8982d5f9301a5
Closes-Bug: #1747349

I'm good with this, but do we need to be concerned with any backwards compat issues? Eg, someone is gathering metrics for this, and the name changes?"}, {'account_id': 6618, 'date': '2016-12-19 16:16:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

It seems to me that even if it is OK to change the name, we should have a release note...'}, {'account_id': 12356, 'date': '2016-12-19 16:29:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: -Code-Review'}, {'account_id': 6618, 'date': '2016-12-19 16:36:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thanks for finding this discrepancy. We (ironic) don't have a policy with respect to metrics and backwards compatibility. Until we do, we shouldn't make any change. At the very least, I think we'd want some deprecation period where we emit metrics to both names, to give operators a chance to change/update whatever they are using to use the new name.

Had a short IRC discussion [1] about this. Mario (irc: mariojv) is going to look into a policy for this.

I think we should also open a bug for this.

[1] http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/irclogs/%23openstack-ironic/%23openstack-ironic.2016-12-19.log.html#t2016-12-19T16:16:11"}, {'account_id': 15333, 'date': '2016-12-20 01:22:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> Thanks for finding this discrepancy. We (ironic) don't have a
 > policy with respect to metrics and backwards compatibility. Until
 > we do, we shouldn't make any change. At the very least, I think
 > we'd want some deprecation period where we emit metrics to both
 > names, to give operators a chance to change/update whatever they
 > are using to use the new name.
 >

 > going to look into a policy for this.
 > 
 > I think we should also open a bug for this.
 > 
 > [1] http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/irclogs/%23openstack-ironic/%23openstack-ironic.2016-12-19.log.html#t2016-12-19T16:16:11

When I find this 

 > Thanks for finding this discrepancy. We (ironic) don't have a
 > policy with respect to metrics and backwards compatibility. Until
 > we do, we shouldn't make any change. At the very least, I think
 > we'd want some deprecation period where we emit metrics to both
 > names, to give operators a chance to change/update whatever they
 > are using to use the new name.
 > 
 > Had a short IRC discussion [1] about this. Mario (irc: mariojv) is
 > going to look into a policy for this.
 > 
 > I think we should also open a bug for this.
 > 
 > [1] http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/irclogs/%23openstack-ironic/%23openstack-ironic.2016-12-19.log.html#t2016-12-19T16:16:11

When I find this incompatibility, I search the whole ironic project, and this is the only mistake in ironic project"}, {'account_id': 15333, 'date': '2016-12-20 01:24:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> It seems to me that even if it is OK to change the name, we should
 > have a release note...

OK, So what can I do for the release note? I want to contribute to the community :)'}, {'account_id': 6618, 'date': '2016-12-20 21:36:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> OK, So what can I do for the release note? I want to contribute to the community :)

Thanks for your enthusiasm, but honestly, until we decide how we want to address this, it might be better if you worked on other things. There are bugs to be fixed and patches to be reviewed and ... :)'}, {'account_id': 13295, 'date': '2017-01-09 22:52:07.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Hi Hao Li,

We decided in the ironic weekly meeting that a release note will be needed for warning users about potential backward incompatibilities with metrics.

Here is some information about how to create a release note for this change: http://docs.openstack.org/developer/ironic/dev/faq.html#know-if-a-release-note-is-needed-for-my-change

I'll be updating that doc and some others shortly to reflect this"}, {'account_id': 6618, 'date': '2018-02-08 23:08:54.000000000', 'content': "Abandoned

Thanks for the patch. This patch hasn't been updated in over a year. I took a look at it again, and I think we should just delete that metric; that is an internal function that is being called by PXEBoot.validate() -- and a metric is being emitted for this already. So I'm abandoning this.

Here's the patch to delete the metric: https://review.openstack.org/542477."}]

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-05 22:41:26.000000000', 'message': "Don't run deployed-server_prepare.sh with config-download

deployed-server_prepare.sh is not needed when using config-download as
Ansible is used to drive the software configuration. We don't need to
configure os-collect-config on each overcloud node.

Change-Id: Ie46ab888532a3513527acb050ea1914867480b90
"}]
commit_message:
Don't run deployed-server_prepare.sh with config-download

deployed-server_prepare.sh is not needed when using config-download as
Ansible is used to drive the software configuration. We don't need to
configure os-collect-config on each overcloud node.

Change-Id: Ie46ab888532a3513527acb050ea1914867480b90

commit_message:
Update exceptions.txt for Rocky PTL candidates

This prolongs a workaround, and the lookup code should probably perform
a lookup directly against the Foundation DB to generate the names, but
sorting that takes longer, so we'll do more of this for now.

Change-Id: Ib792b96c083951aeaf4284ed92a3c5fb7380c2d0

commit_message:
re-enable skipped HA test after workaround

An import cycle issue in eventlet caused failure when launching
replica congress instance for HA test. The HA test was skipped.

Now that we have a work-around, re-enable the HA test.

Related-Bug: 1746136
Closes-Bug: 1745112

Depends-On: I72c349e81dfc02136b22637c707ad4908c9f269e
Change-Id: Ieeb8db6e1b40192c4b877b556718d12f6254b399

"}, {'created': '2017-12-04 10:44:01.000000000', 'message': "Build everything on metal

This also uses the check to pip upstream url to determine or
not if pip needs lock down.
If it's not available yet, don't lock down.

The gate check commit is adapted to skip non metal plays,
and ensure DNS resolution can work.

On top of that, we skip the git cloning into itself through
and url like git://internal_lb_address/reponame, and use
point to the already local checkout of reponame (only needs
to happen for external git clones of nova consoles).

Depends-On: Ic09f6a9ee28e3f7919226f22b803ee1a1b8ad53d
Depends-On: I0d345a6d488b89d888780cc3d39e27b1cd1fdfd0
Change-Id: I67199e1f35c91c4e2c9973e011e856c6ac3fb086

Change-Id: I67199e1f35c91c4e2c9973e011e856c6ac3fb086
"}, {'created': '2018-02-07 17:27:23.000000000', 'message': "Build everything on metal

This also uses the check to pip upstream url to determine or
not if pip needs lock down. If it's not available yet,
don't lock down.

The bootstrap-aio has been adapted to make possible to run
rabbitmq on metal.

The gate check commit is adapted to skip non metal plays.

Change-Id: I67199e1f35c91c4e2c9973e011e856c6ac3fb086
"}, {'created': '2018-02-08 12:28:02.000000000', 'message': "Implement a scenario with no containers

In order to demonstrate that OSA can be built without
any containers, and to validate on a continuous basis
that it still works, a new scenario is implemented to
test it.

As part of this, the following is done:

1. An example environment override file is added which
   sets all the containers with 'is_metal: true' which
   disables the container creation.

2. As haproxy is not used for the scenario on an AIO,
   the haproxy environment configuration is broken out
   from openstack_user_config into its own conf.d file
   and the implementation of it into user space is added
   to all other scenarios.

3. To ensure that the pip lockdown configuration is not
   implemented by the pip install role when the repo
   server doesn't exist yet, we ensure that the var is
   set in the playbook that does the validation.

4. To ensure that rabbitmq is able to correctly start
   up we implement the same host name on the host as
   we do in the inventory. Without this rabbitmq fails.

5. The workflow for a deployment needs no changes
   because when the lxc-related playbooks execute, they
   simply skip over because the lxc-related groups are
   empty.

Change-Id: I67199e1f35c91c4e2c9973e011e856c6ac3fb086

commit_message:
Implement a scenario with no containers

In order to demonstrate that OSA can be built without
any containers, and to validate on a continuous basis
that it still works, a new scenario is implemented to
test it.

As part of this, the following is done:

1. An example environment override file is added which
   sets all the containers with 'is_metal: true' which
   disables the container creation.

2. As haproxy is not used for the scenario on an AIO,
   the haproxy environment configuration is broken out
   from openstack_user_config into its own conf.d file
   and the implementation of it into user space is added
   to all other scenarios.

3. To ensure that the pip lockdown configuration is not
   implemented by the pip install role when the repo
   server doesn't exist yet, we ensure that the var is
   set in the playbook that does the validation.

4. To ensure that rabbitmq is able to correctly start
   up we implement the same host name on the host as
   we do in the inventory. Without this rabbitmq fails.
   In order to do this successfully with ansible, the
   dbus package must be installed on the host, so it is
   added as part of the AIO bootstrapping.

5. The workflow for a deployment needs no changes
   because when the lxc-related playbooks execute, they
   simply skip over because the lxc-related groups are
   empty.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/542307
Change-Id: I67199e1f35c91c4e2c9973e011e856c6ac3fb086

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-02-09 07:35:46.000000000', 'message': 'Fix error message for image validation

When execute "ironic node-set-provision-state <node-uuid> active" command
for the node which has no instance_info/image_source,
error message is shown like below:

Failed to validate deploy or power info for node <node-uuid>.
Error: Cannot validate image information for node <node-uuid>
because one or more parameters are missing from its instance_info..
Missing are: ['ramdisk', 'kernel', 'image_source']

If we want to do deploy with whole disk image,
ramdisk and kernel are unnecessary, so this error message is
not proper.

This patch set fix this error message to:

Failed to validate deploy or power info for node <node-uuid>.
...
Missing are: ['image_source']

Change-Id: Ic63b2cb7e085944a8171fa89a2376ae17e08a84f
'}]
commit_message:
Fix error message for image validation

When execute "ironic node-set-provision-state <node-uuid> active" command
for the node which has no instance_info/image_source,
error message is shown like below:

Failed to validate deploy or power info for node <node-uuid>.
Error: Cannot validate image information for node <node-uuid>
because one or more parameters are missing from its instance_info..
Missing are: ['ramdisk', 'kernel', 'image_source']

If we want to do deploy with whole disk image,
ramdisk and kernel are unnecessary, so this error message is
not proper.

This patch set fix this error message to:

Failed to validate deploy or power info for node <node-uuid>.
...
Missing are: ['image_source']

Change-Id: Ic63b2cb7e085944a8171fa89a2376ae17e08a84f

commit_message:
RedHat: Ensure that conflicting MariaDB packages are removed

When the galera_client role is deployed along with other roles, some
of them may pull mariadb packages as a dependency for the services
they deploy. However, this role uses MariaDB packages from the upstream
repository which conflict with those provided by the EPEL or the RDO
ones so we need to ensure that they are gone before we install the
upstream ones.

Closes-Bug: #1739472
Change-Id: Ie1a2126986ee95671ece79374e1385846c8cce1a

[{'created': '2018-02-08 21:19:14.000000000', 'message': 'Fix translation scripts

The scripts are run from {{ ansible_user_dir }}/scripts/, so copy to

commit_message:
Fix translation scripts

The scripts are run from {{ ansible_user_dir }}/scripts/, so copy to
that place. In this case we do not need sudo access.

See playbooks/translation/upstream-translation.yaml for
invocation.

Change-Id: I792d991ead1217a223e3f81fe9096d6a8ba737d9

commit_message:
test-set-nodepool-vars: Add nodepool mirror discovery for openSUSE

openSUSE mirros are now configurable in the
openstack-ansible-openstack-hosts role so we need to make sure we are
using the internal OpenStack ones when running in zuul. This patch also
modifies the code to check for /etc/nodepool instead of
/etc/nodepool/provider because the latter doesn't seem to exist anymore.

Change-Id: I6df997e13f678faaddac8b5d1818f2906bac08ec

commit_message:
Add incoming storage driver param

We need a way to not enable redis incoming driver in tls
case. Lets expose a param to override the default
behavior.

Depends-On: I5b71099d2e1c25b86ceed430f15ee28ef0f37f5c

Change-Id: I63ba2735912ee5f8f5880bba6e4320f2eaa51f92

[{'created': '2016-10-06 04:19:59.000000000', 'message': 'Fix doc build if git is absent

When building packages if git is absent, then we should not set
html_last_updated_fmt. It can still be set via the -D switch
when building with sphinx-build.

commit_message:
doc:Log warning when can't get information from git

This is follow up of commit a1a1c89c0d2963e4496cc8e7c0f1e6d0aa3a3104,
add warning to indicate something is wrong when getting last updated
information from git repository.

Closes-Bug: #1552251
Change-Id: I1247d3ff09ff1ab81aaeff0eb81432f595a79c7d

commit_message:
Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

Change-Id: I96257951e414b2423098be155c0e283f125abf70

Add python 3.x classifier

There are tests for python 3.4 and 3.5 now. So we can
tell users that Ironic supports python 3.4 and 3.5.

commit_message:
Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

Change-Id: Ia050ba40dbb6b63e9286a3967cf420f9940ac3db

commit_message:
Support maximum capacity for SR-IOV VNIC

This patchset handles maxcapacity in binding profile of Neutron port
for SR-IOV. maxcapacity is retrieved from binding profile and pushed into
vif object. Additional changes will be in nova_powervm vif driver to
gather and validate and pass onto pypowervm layer.

In both nova_powervm and pypowervm layers of code, maximum capacity is
validated. Maximum capacity cannot be less than capacity (minimum capacity)
and maximum capacity cannot be greater than 1 (100 %).

Change-Id: I0eb627b94e66158c68fddd7a2a5fc90467efc20d

[{'account_id': 18124, 'date': '2016-06-22 02:09:24.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2016-06-22 02:09:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
    Workflow: http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
    Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 19339, 'date': '2016-06-22 02:11:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

commit_message:
KeystoneFailure: Could not authorize in Keystone: A username and password or token is required.

ironic.conf must be username,password and toke in the keystone_authtoken,so i add admin_user,
admin_password and admin_tenant_name.

Closes-Bug: 1594726

Change-Id: Ib8c3854b4ab7698d0e8de5fadb8b646e14a84380

commit_message:
Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

Change-Id: Iec95d6688b3daba0d1d0fcb4da01a31b280b1400

[{'created': '2018-01-30 21:22:57.000000000', 'message': '[WIP] Replace pxelinux with iPXE support in MNAIO

Adds support for iPXE scripting.  Allows for the
operator to specify a remote iPXE kernel to pull in
newer iPXE kernel features and specify a remote
default iPXE script for customizing the multi node
for other types of deployments.

Switches the installations to use netboot installer kernels
instead of ISO retrival and extraction.

Lays the framework for provisioning the multinode for
CentOS installs.  CentOS kickstarts and networking configs still
need to be generated and added.

commit_message:
Replace pxelinux with iPXE support in MNAIO

Adds support for iPXE scripting.  Allows for the
operator to specify a remote iPXE kernel to pull in
newer iPXE kernel features and specify a remote
default iPXE script for customizing the multi node
for other types of deployments.

Switches the installations to use netboot installer kernels
instead of ISO retrival and extraction.

Restructures directory to allow for future multi node configs
instead of just debian based installs.

Change-Id: Ie97f021dbd33ad3d852132b0b2850f54d4e13476

commit_message:
Stop any running VMs when re-deploying

Stops running VMs when doing a deploy to ensure
the VMs start fresh and can reload their config
during deploy.

Also removes LVs to force a redeploy of the VMs.

Change-Id: I7992e25f4e0e103ae66487f2e88a99ca962a9355

commit_message:
Prevent latest mariadb version

Latest mariadb version has a bug that prevents clustering from
behaving properly in bootstrap.

This setups the repo for the galera_client to the same as
galera_server, to have the same client version.

Revise s3_hadoop

* Handle Hadoop classpath better
* Include proper support for Spark classpath
* Formally limit element's use to Vanilla and Spark

commit_message:
Workaround glanceclient bug when CONF.glance.api_servers not set

In certain configurations, like when setting [service_user]
config, and not setting [glance]/api_servers, the KSA adapter
get endpoint code (new in Queens) will return a versioned URL
which glanceclient doesn't handle (due to bug 1707995) so we
need to workaround that by parsing the URL to strip the version
from the endpoint URL we got from KSA.

This is validated in the nova-next CI job which configures a
service user token for glance.

Change-Id: I363182e916480c734cc37f279e8e89c8f3ec653c
Closes-Bug: #1747511
Related-Bug: #1707995

commit_message:
Fix the dellemc vmax to use the correct hiera name

Corrected the hiera variable names to match the puppet
code for the dell emc vmax driver

Change-Id: I9392d42bc2689b59eb76aaf5c51648b2d0d85293
(cherry picked from commit b008e04ae3c4f7aa1f90c0b029d2e251aed8bd2c)

[{'created': '2018-01-18 18:26:29.000000000', 'message': "Fix ansible warning with jinja2 delimiters

Ansible starting with version 2.3 warns about jinja2 delimiters used in
'when' statements:

  [WARNING]: when statements should not include jinja2 templating
  delimiters such as {{ }} or {% %}

Change-Id: Idccda187671a0454157b831fc7c6b0eadde173c9
"}]
commit_message:
Fix ansible warning with jinja2 delimiters

Ansible starting with version 2.3 warns about jinja2 delimiters used in
'when' statements:

  [WARNING]: when statements should not include jinja2 templating
  delimiters such as {{ }} or {% %}

Change-Id: Idccda187671a0454157b831fc7c6b0eadde173c9

subject: Collect files from /etc/yum.repos.d/
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-08 17:51:55.000000000', 'message': "Collect files from /etc/yum.repos.d/

The actual yum repository files weren't being collected by the tests
job. This patch ensures that they are collected.

This should add 8-12 files to each job run.

Change-Id: Idb1648ab89a9986c2c0aec42ba84451cda29e28d
"}]
commit_message:
Collect files from /etc/yum.repos.d/

The actual yum repository files weren't being collected by the tests
job. This patch ensures that they are collected.

This should add 8-12 files to each job run.

Change-Id: Idb1648ab89a9986c2c0aec42ba84451cda29e28d

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-16 14:29:43.000000000', 'message': "Restrict resolvers to IPv4 addresses

Previously, the overcloud-prep-network.sh script would parse
/etc/resolv.conf and add all resolvers found in the file to the ctlplane
neutron subnet unless the overcloud_dns_servers variable is set.

In the case the host machine has IPv6 enabled, this causes the neutron
subnet-update command to fail on IPv6 addresses with:

  Invalid input for operation: dns_nameserver '2a01:e00::1' does not
  match the ip_version '4'.

This commit filters out IPv6 addresses.

Change-Id: I4f287015b6161b615eb95312b528d6a392a54d90
Closes-Bug: #1736264

commit_message:
Restrict resolvers to IPv4 addresses

Previously, the overcloud-prep-network.sh script would parse
/etc/resolv.conf and add all resolvers found in the file to the ctlplane
neutron subnet unless the overcloud_dns_servers variable is set.

In the case the host machine has IPv6 enabled, this causes the neutron
subnet-update command to fail on IPv6 addresses with:

  Invalid input for operation: dns_nameserver '2a01:e00::1' does not
  match the ip_version '4'.

This commit filters out IPv6 addresses.

Change-Id: I4f287015b6161b615eb95312b528d6a392a54d90
Closes-Bug: #1736264

commit_message:
Add prometheus exporters to osh charts

This moves the prometheus exporters for services into a directory
in the chart themselves. This keeps the monitoring services
coupled to the services theyre meant to monitor. This changes the
chart directory structure to include a monitoring/ directory to
host any monitoring requirements (not just prometheus exporters)

Change-Id: Ic5f46a7e9a2a773a837ff399b8730782cf89f1de

[{'created': '2016-10-19 02:26:49.000000000', 'message': "agent heartbeat: upgrade lock when needed

In the agent's heartbeat() method, we were always upgrading to an
exclusive lock (instead of a shared lock) for the task. This changes
it so that we only upgrade to an exclusive lock when it is needed.

Change-Id: I999f5ae11096bc7b6e81c99056f7aafb13868faa
"}]
commit_message:
agent heartbeat: upgrade lock when needed

In the agent's heartbeat() method, we were always upgrading to an
exclusive lock (instead of a shared lock) for the task. This changes
it so that we only upgrade to an exclusive lock when it is needed.

Change-Id: I999f5ae11096bc7b6e81c99056f7aafb13868faa

[{'account_id': 25854, 'date': '2017-04-26 20:55:38.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2017-04-26 20:55:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
    Workflow: http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html

I was wondering, what if an admin sets `images_type = lvm` in  `/etc/kolla/config/nova/nova-compute.conf`, whilst having `enable_nova_images_backend_lvm: "no"` in the `etc/kolla/globals.yml` file?

Then he will still be surprised why does the nova_compute cause all the LVM-related command to hang on `semop()` as described in the bug https://bugs.launchpad.net/kolla-ansible/+bug/1686513 .


Which would mean that we either need to point in the documentation that one must use `enable_nova_images_backend_lvm: yes` whenever he wants `images_type = lvm` in his `/etc/kolla/config/nova/nova-compute.conf` configuration, so that nova_compute does not cause the LVM-related commands to hang.

Or we should make kolla-ansible read whether `images_type` is set to `lvm` in the `/etc/kolla/config/nova/nova-compute.conf` and then enable `ipc_mode: host` based on that... but that would mean re-creation of the nova_compute container each time that config changes. Isn't it an overhead / not a good behavior?

IMHO, making the `ipc_mode: host` as a permanent option for nova_volumes is a more sane approach to this...

Please let me know what do you think?'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2017-05-02 17:08:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: Verified+1

commit_message:
Enable nova compute LVM backend

This allows nova compute to spawn the instances using the LVM backend
instead of the traditional /var/lib/nova/instances/<UUID>/disk.

Change-Id: I1f3aa64c9e4cd41494b5e6eca7fffec14006650b
Closes-Bug: #1686513

The images being used (trusty64) were not compatible with
current devstack/openstack. And also the parallels support was
broken by using unsupported options.

Both things have been fixed, and bento project[1] images
have been used because of cross compatibility with several

Change-Id: Ie83de3cd2878fa709f92d3f85452cde25ce4e9bb
'}]
commit_message:
Fix vagrant definitions for parallels and up-to-date images

The images being used (trusty64) were not compatible with
current devstack/openstack. And also the parallels support was
broken by using unsupported options.

Both things have been fixed, and bento project[1] images
have been used because of cross compatibility with several
hypervisors.

[1] https://github.com/chef/bento

Change-Id: Ie83de3cd2878fa709f92d3f85452cde25ce4e9bb

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-30 13:54:08.000000000', 'message': "Invert order when collecting logs in tempest-post-common.yml

This patch is inverting the order of the tasks in the
tempest-post-common.yml file because, in case the job fails before
devstack ran successfully, there's a chance that the OVN databases
weren't created yet. This would make the task collecting the database
files to fail and and return before the task that collect the rest of
the logs is executed.

Change-Id: I8a5fca9203124d0d405bdf6f159b6bfecf51059c
"}]
commit_message:
Invert order when collecting logs in tempest-post-common.yml

This patch is inverting the order of the tasks in the
tempest-post-common.yml file because, in case the job fails before
devstack ran successfully, there's a chance that the OVN databases
weren't created yet. This would make the task collecting the database
files to fail and and return before the task that collect the rest of
the logs is executed.

Change-Id: I8a5fca9203124d0d405bdf6f159b6bfecf51059c

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-07 20:26:52.000000000', 'message': "undercloud/netconfig: switch to net-config by default

Deploying an undercloud with noop netconfig by default isn't what
TripleO is doing by default:

http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/python-tripleoclient/tree/tripleoclient/v1/undercloud_config.py#n576
http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/tree/environments/undercloud.yaml#n4

We shouldn't change this behavior.
Instead, change the default to match with that is in THT, but keep the
users override the resource with another netconfig.

Change-Id: I2107a83feeb1620de446ec40975f7e5289c3c741
"}]
commit_message:
undercloud/netconfig: switch to net-config by default

Deploying an undercloud with noop netconfig by default isn't what
TripleO is doing by default:

http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/python-tripleoclient/tree/tripleoclient/v1/undercloud_config.py#n576
http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/tree/environments/undercloud.yaml#n4

We shouldn't change this behavior.
Instead, change the default to match with that is in THT, but keep the
users override the resource with another netconfig.

Change-Id: I2107a83feeb1620de446ec40975f7e5289c3c741

messages: [{'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-02-08 16:45:10.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2018-02-08 18:31:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 538, 'date': '2018-02-08 18:32:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-08 16:45:10.000000000', 'message': 'Properly check for an existing log directory

If a log directory already exists, and is a link, these
tasks fail. This patch modifies the process to ensure
that the task works regardless of whether the existing
directory is a directory or a link, and creates the
missing directory if necessary.

Change-Id: I519d7196806f9b97186429b02474274708a8d441
'}]
commit_message:
Properly check for an existing log directory

If a log directory already exists, and is a link, these
tasks fail. This patch modifies the process to ensure
that the task works regardless of whether the existing
directory is a directory or a link, and creates the
missing directory if necessary.

Change-Id: I519d7196806f9b97186429b02474274708a8d441

commit_message:
Add Puppet package to bindep, for module build

We need Puppet package deployed from bindep so we can
run puppet module build with the new zuul v3 job.

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-27 06:37:25.000000000', 'message': "Image data stays in store if image is deleted after staging call

Trying to delete image after staging call image gets deleted
from the database, but image data remains in the
backend ('/tmp/staging' directory).

Deleted image data from the backend ('/tmp/staging' directory) if
image_import is enabled and image is in uploading state while
deleting.

Change-Id: I6ef1c05760a27a0b3620024003b49328c55f19a6
Closes-Bug: #1733289
"}, {'created': '2017-11-28 03:55:11.000000000', 'message': 'Delete data if image is deleted after staging call

Trying to delete image after staging call image gets deleted
from the database, but image data remains in the
staging area.

Deleted image data from the staging area if image_import is
enabled and image is in uploading state while deleting.

Closes-Bug: #1733289
Change-Id: I6ef1c05760a27a0b3620024003b49328c55f19a6
'}]
commit_message:
Delete data if image is deleted after staging call

Trying to delete image after staging call image gets deleted
from the database, but image data remains in the
staging area.

Deleted image data from the staging area if image_import is
enabled and image is in uploading state while deleting.

Closes-Bug: #1733289
Change-Id: I6ef1c05760a27a0b3620024003b49328c55f19a6

commit_message:
Update the valid disk bus list for qemu and kvm hypervisors

The Nova project has added 'sata' as a valid disk bus for qemu and
kvm hypervisors, see https://review.openstack.org/#/c/459794/6

DocImpact: add to metadefs release note

Related-Bug: #1686136
Change-Id: If8e23756616e46391827ac3d85d287940862613f

This commit prevents silent failures when encountering a resource with no name,
which has been observed with glance images that are in a "queued" state.

Closes-Bug: #1746539
(cherry picked from commit ed1a2581825effe63277f5620f2b126c1ff7c999)
'}]
commit_message:
Handle resources with no name

This commit prevents silent failures when encountering a resource with no name,
which has been observed with glance images that are in a "queued" state.

Change-Id: I65aec02c4e5ac66811006ec7f6ab0c17056ffdb7
Closes-Bug: #1746539
(cherry picked from commit ed1a2581825effe63277f5620f2b126c1ff7c999)

commit_message:
Add support for pre undercloud upgrade workarounds

This change adds the workarounds template support for applying
workarounds before starting the undercloud fast forward upgrade.

Change-Id: Ife2a255e78335360bf10eaff3310ff1412e3d88f

commit_message:
Fix typo that can prevent undercloud installation.

The interface to sdk.network.segments use network_id, not network[1].

Closes-Bug: #1748199

[1] https://github.com/openstack/python-openstacksdk/blob/master/openstack/network/v2/segment.py#L30..L34

Change-Id: Ibda590103ed8b02a1ce05e285a3d9d9ea2e2ff7f

commit_message:
update documentation

remove link to metadata configuration from
devstack section. metadata is configured by plugin's
script for devstack and user doesn't require to
configure it by himself.
Add information how to configure metadata over SSL

Change-Id: I9ecfc10fed15a73417e840ddecac8a8a56d18601
Closes-Bug: #1739479

messages: [{'account_id': 12021, 'date': '2018-02-08 15:53:32.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 12021, 'date': '2018-02-08 18:01:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-08 15:53:32.000000000', 'message': "bagpipe-bgp: fix dummy dataplane drivers

commit 025f38411f64f43beb67b61db81f38acf6a34e73 had missed
the addition of the 'direction' parameter to vi_(un)plugged
methods of dummy dataplane drivers

This change modifies the code for dummy drivers so that
they don't need to be modified for each signature change.

Change-Id: I8f8573f57778bc1892ad30c7f1c775fb600728af
"}]
commit_message:
bagpipe-bgp: fix dummy dataplane drivers

commit 025f38411f64f43beb67b61db81f38acf6a34e73 had missed
the addition of the 'direction' parameter to vi_(un)plugged
methods of dummy dataplane drivers

This change modifies the code for dummy drivers so that
they don't need to be modified for each signature change.

Change-Id: I8f8573f57778bc1892ad30c7f1c775fb600728af

commit_message:
Remove placement_database related options/code

The placement_database config options were added in Newton
but the actual code to use the options was reverted and is
not used.

Change-Id: Ifb09747056750893e442ebe0b4124e861a70ae55
Related-Reviews: I31293ac4689630e4113588ab2c6373cf572b8f38
Closes-Bug: #1670419

commit_message:
Helm-Toolkit: move keystone endpoint jobs to helm-toolkit

This PS moves the keystone endpoint jobs to be driven by
a helm-toolkit function providing greater consistency
to the charts in OSH, and reduced tech debt.

Change-Id: I06555171ce93a2b0a8798bc891a2990ea9626276

commit_message:
Increase logging for overcloud container uploads

We've seen random failures in the overcloud container uploads and the
verbosity of the upload command leaves something to be desired. Let's
see if increasing it improves the ability to figure out what is going
wrong.

Change-Id: I093e609c678673e7eface56a014d344e7707ac63

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be

    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

commit_message:
Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

Change-Id: Ibde85013357f34d914f65fb3c92fb7fa4bf86528

[{'created': '2018-02-08 13:45:43.000000000', 'message': "Don't enable ovn-metadata-agent if ovn-controller is disabled

On a devstack multinode deployment, if you try to configure
a controller without ovn-controller in it, it will fail, because
we try to configure ovn-metadata-agent by default, and it will
fail.

Change-Id: Ic5917a87e421206043fd6571b9040b9fa5f2af5a
"}]
commit_message:
Don't enable ovn-metadata-agent if ovn-controller is disabled

On a devstack multinode deployment, if you try to configure
a controller without ovn-controller in it, it will fail, because
we try to configure ovn-metadata-agent by default, and it will
fail.

Change-Id: Ic5917a87e421206043fd6571b9040b9fa5f2af5a

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-26 01:50:51.000000000', 'message': "[WIP] Fix an issue on creating resource

If a user requests to create a resource and the resource is successfully
created but some attributes are dropped, the resource attributes will be
populated incorrectly. For example:

Request: {'is_default': True, 'name': 'xx'}
Response: {'name': 'xx', ...} ('is_default' is not returned)
Resource attributes: {'is_default': True, 'name': 'xx', ...}

In this case, I expect the resource attributes does not have 'is_default'.
However, the resource attributes does actually have 'is_default'.

An example is to call create_network by setting is_default to true.
If the created network is not an external network, the neutron server
won't return the 'is_default' attribute in the response.

Change-Id: I92bb8a7a6dcb8b07886271fc6d59303c41a37eb8
"}]
commit_message:
[WIP] Fix an issue on creating resource

If a user requests to create a resource and the resource is successfully
created but some attributes are dropped, the resource attributes will be
populated incorrectly. For example:

Request: {'is_default': True, 'name': 'xx'}
Response: {'name': 'xx', ...} ('is_default' is not returned)
Resource attributes: {'is_default': True, 'name': 'xx', ...}

In this case, I expect the resource attributes does not have 'is_default'.
However, the resource attributes does actually have 'is_default'.

An example is to call create_network by setting is_default to true.
If the created network is not an external network, the neutron server
won't return the 'is_default' attribute in the response.

Change-Id: I92bb8a7a6dcb8b07886271fc6d59303c41a37eb8

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-05 16:55:17.000000000', 'message': "Fix time accounting for the maintenance thread

It won't make much difference but we're accounting the time of
the log which should be insignificant compared to the duration
of the maintenance task. Still, it's best to stop the timer
before that just in case.

Change-Id: Ic939d73e7ce9e694ff2e501ab967d619874e7eea
Signed-off-by: Daniel Alvarez <dalvarez@redhat.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Fix time accounting for the maintenance thread

It won't make much difference but we're accounting the time of
the log which should be insignificant compared to the duration
of the maintenance task. Still, it's best to stop the timer
before that just in case.

Change-Id: Ic939d73e7ce9e694ff2e501ab967d619874e7eea
Signed-off-by: Daniel Alvarez <dalvarez@redhat.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-05 12:26:49.000000000', 'message': 'Maintenance: Skip fixing resources deleted mid-operation

This is mostly a cosmetic fix. the patch just handling (and logging) a
situation where a resource is deleted mid-operation while the maintenance
thread is looping thru and fixing the list of inconsistent resources.

Change-Id: Ic9d4e26c12a70599d7ea86d3fe11b1ba68ff5619
'}]
commit_message:
Maintenance: Skip fixing resources deleted mid-operation

This is mostly a cosmetic fix. the patch just handling (and logging) a
situation where a resource is deleted mid-operation while the maintenance
thread is looping thru and fixing the list of inconsistent resources.

Change-Id: Ic9d4e26c12a70599d7ea86d3fe11b1ba68ff5619
